loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle.

Sonia has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 63 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children now at their adult age.

Felicidad has earned a living through sales from her snack-vending business, particularly “suman balintawak [sticky rice cakes mixed with cocoa],” for 10 years already and earns approximately Php2,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in redemption of her pawned cocoa farmland. The remaining amount will be used as additional capital for her suman balintawak business.

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to expand her suman balintawak-making business to other municipalities.

loans.use: to be used in redemption of her pawned cocoa farmland.

loans.name: Guido Alfonso

texts.es:
Al ver a Guido se puede notar que es un joven enérgico y emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante.
Tiene un pequeño negocio de fabricación de calzado en el cual trabaja según contratos con almacenes.
Trabaja todos los días y aprendió el oficio de su padre quien fue zapatero toda su vida.
El es muy inquieto y desea aumentar su producción ya que tiene algunos pedidos estancados y desea evacuarlos para conservar sus clientes y obtener así sus ganancias.
Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de cueros, pegas, hilos y suelas, con estos materiales podrá continuar con su producción y dará un impulso muy importante a su negocio con capital.
El es soltero y los ingresos que obtiene los invierte en el negocio y en los gastos que tiene en su hogar.
Sus padres han sido su apoyo más grande.
texts.en:
Just looking at Guido, you can see that he is an energetic and enterprising young man with hopes of getting ahead.

He has a small shoe-making business that he works at, off contracts with stores.

He works every day. He learned the trade from his father who was a cobbler his whole life.

Guido is tenacious and wants to increase his production because he has some back orders, and he wants to fill them in order to keep his customers and get income from them.

It is for this reason that he is requesting a loan to purchase leather, glue, thread, and soles. With these materials, he will be able to continue production and make a very important infusion of capital into his business.

Guido is single, and he will reinvest the money he earns back into the business, as well as pay for household expenses.

His parents have been his greatest support.

loans.use: to purchase shoe shop materials.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Liderando las Palmeras” ,la socia continua brindando el servicio  de movilidad escolar, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro como en el cambio de aceite.
La socia agradece por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir sus cuotas establecidas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Liderando las Palmeras" communal bank. She continues providing school transport services. She is a responsible and diligent person. For years, the member has been working this business, which is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. The member wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member is requesting this loan to do car maintenance, such as changing the oil.

The member is grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on time and very responsibly.

loans.use: to do car maintenance, such as change the oil.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 43 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children who are now at their adult age and school age. For her means of living, Lucila has been engaged in managing a sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products for one year already, and earns approximately PHP3,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing construction materials for house repair.

Lucila has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future Lucila hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma has been working in the government for many years while her husband serves as a barangay official in their community. She has a motorcycle that she uses for her personal transportation; she also offers motor rental in order to earn extra income for her family's daily needs. To maintain better services and safety, she took a new loan to buy new tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life she provides for her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hens and chickens to fatten up and to make improvements to his chicken coop so they can have more space and more comfort.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kam Rieang district of Battambang province, Navy is a 31-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are still in school while another one is too young for school. To make a living, she and her husband work as construction workers. Sometimes, they work for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 24,000KHR per day to meet their family’s needs and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day for their future needs. 

Navy is on her first cycle with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy construction materials to support her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to support her business.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder es un hombre trabajador, tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ucayali junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 7 años se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales cultivos son el caco, plátano y maíz, y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, emprendedora, y sobre todo porque tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de cultivos y produce excelentes productos.
Wilder está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar insumos como fertilizantes y plaguicidas para poder realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos y de esta manera pueda obtener productos de mayor calidad con el que obtendrá mayores ingresos, así, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación más adelante podrá cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Ampliar sus cultivos de cacao".
texts.en:
Wilder is a hardworking man. He is 33 years old, single, and lives in Ucayali with his family.

For more than seven years, he has been farming. His main crops are cacao, plantains, and corn. It's going very well for him because he is a very responsible, enterprising person, and above all, because he has a lot of experience in these types of crops and produces excellent products.

Wilder is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they've given, he will be able to purchase supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides in order to maintain his crops. This way, he can get better quality products with which he can earn better income. So, with great effort and dedication, he will later be able to reach one of his highest goals: to expand his cacao crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (fertilizers and pesticides).

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Phnom Prek district of Battambang province, Ven is aged 55 years and married. She has four children. To support the family, she and her husband have been growing corn and cabbage for 15 years. 
Ven has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Loly

texts.en: Loly, 61 years of age, is widowed and has two children. Loly has been in the hog raising business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. Her income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses and electric bills. Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like to take a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase hog feed, and a hog to raise. Loly is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds, and a hog to raise

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 55 years of age. She is managing a boarding house business, while her husband works as a government employee. The couple are gifted with six children. Though they do have good sources of income, they can’t pay the tuition fees of all their children who are attending school. Because of that, Lolita wants to take a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 15,000 for the tuition fee of Judy Anne, who is a 3rd year student taking up BS Instrumentation and Control Engineering in Rizal Technological University. 

Judy Anne believes that with a college diploma she can have a profitable job which would be a great way for her to help her family finance their expenditures. With that she hopes that lenders will grant her mother’s requested loan.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her child

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 57 años de edad y desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja como alfarera. Ella elabora variedad de productos a base de barro como comales, ollas, alcancías, etc. De esta forma se gana  la vida y colabora con la economía de su familia.  Ángela solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el cambio del techo de dos cuartos y para construir una pared. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, lámina galvanizada, hierro y pagará la mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en: Ángela is 57 years old and has worked as a potter for a long time. She makes a variety of products from clay such as hotplates, pots, piggy banks, etc. In this way, she makes a living and helps with the family finances. Angela is requesting this loan from Kiva partner FUSAI to invest in replacing the roof on two rooms and constructing a wall. With the requested amount, she will purchase cement, sand, bricks, galvanized steel, and iron, and pay for a helping hand for the construction.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, galvanized steel, and iron, and to pay for a helping hand to construct a wall and roof for two rooms.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 58 years old and lives in Motosawa Dumalinao ZDS, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.

Leonila has a tailoring business and earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to purchase additional clothing.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for 3 months. In the future, she hopes to open another tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing for tailoring.

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with three children.  

Teresita, in the Philippines, is in the agricultural business of pig fattening. Teresita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and maintain fishing nets.

loans.name: Christine Jane

texts.en:
Christine Jane finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 23 and a married woman, she busies herself with sufficiently providing for the family. 

Christine Jane grabbed the opportunity to become a fully pledged member of PMPC. She credits to the cooperative her capital in supporting her gardening activities. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase gardening tools and fertilizers. In the future, Christine Jane wishes to become the supplier of agri-products in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Basilsan

texts.en:
Basilsan is married and operates a fishing business with her husband to make a living. She vends the fish in their village. She has been in this field of business for five years and she earns good income to provide for her family. 

Recently she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy new fishing nets used for fishing. In the future, the couple wants to own a stall in the market in town where they could vend fish.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 45 years old and lives in Motosawa Dumalinao ZDS, Philippines. She is separated with 3 children.

Julieta has a sand and gravel business and earns approximately 11,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan to have additional capital for her sand and gravel.

Julieta has been a member of PMPC for 2 months. In the future, she hopes to have more clients.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her sand and gravel.

location.town: Pagadian - Motosawa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
This is Rosita. She owns and operates a food stall. She has been successful in this business for many years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income through her small variety store.

Relative to this, Rosita would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 10,000 to buy products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities. She will also use part of the loan to increase her profit through her mini-grocery store.

Rosita hopes for her business to flourish. She dreams of a well-off and happy living with her family. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as she enjoys sharing God’s love and provision in her life.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, in larger quantities, for her variety store

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her vegetable-vending business and is now requesting a PHP 8270 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Virginia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ponh's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Kam Rieang district, Ponh is aged 50 years and married with eight children. To make a living and support her family, Ponh and her husband have been growing cassava and sometimes she works for others for a fee. 

This is the second micro loan for Ponh with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to request a loan, Ponh, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to cultivate her rice to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Brazio

texts.en:
Brazio is a new borrower, aged 41years old. He is a married man with 5 children and he applied for a loan of 1,500,000 shillings. 

The purpose of the loan is to buy goats for fattening and then sell them later for a profit. He has enough land but he does not have enough goats to occupy that farmland. He has the challenge of limited capital, so he cannot buy many more goats. He thinks buying more will help him to get enough income to educate his children in better schools and also improve his standard of living. 

Inset is the client and the Ugafode credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy baby goats.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 34 years old, married, and a resident of Bagacay, Larena, Siquijor. He earns a living through a sari-sari (general) store.

Eduardo has been a member of PMPC for 2 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, he is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase a variety of goods such as canned goods, beverages, toothpaste and shampoos. Through this, he hopes to increase his income and be of help in the expansion of his business. 

Eduardo deeply wishes to maintain his status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional canned goods, beverages, toothpaste and shampoos for his sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia earns a better income from her fishing business and because of this was able to develop a swine fattening business to make more income for living. She successfully repaid her previous loans used for buying nets and recently took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies for her pigs. 

All she wants is to repair their own house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies for her pig business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 59 years old and married with five children.

Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like snack foods, soft-drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, bath soap, beers, etc. to sell.

Victoria has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Victoria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, shampoo, sanitary pads, bath soap, beers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married woman with seven children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel, gracias a la ayuda de interactuar, pudo comprar un papelería muy reconocida en el municipio de Marinilla, desde allí atiende todo tipo de clientes ofreciéndoles variados productos.
Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y desde hace 2 años que compro este negocio, logrando unas muy buenas ventas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de artículos de oficina, útiles escolares, accesorios y variedades.
Para complementar el servicio de impresión y fotocopias que en este momento ofrece en su papelería.
Su mayor desafío es el poco tiempo que lleva administrando el negocio y siente que aún le falta mucho por aprender.
texts.en:
Isabel, thanks to the help from Kiva partner Interactuar, was able to purchase a well-known stationery shop in the city of Marinilla. From there, she helps all sorts of customers, offering them a variety of products.

She is an enterprising woman, and for two years since she bought the business, she has had excellent sales.

She is requesting a loan to purchase an inventory of office supplies, school supplies, accessories, and other things to supplement her printing and photocopying services, which she currently offers in her stationery shop.

Her biggest challenge is how little time she has been running the business, and she feels that she still has a lot to learn.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her stationery store.

loans.name: Soklin's Group

texts.en:
Soklin is 22 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kam Rieang district of Battambang province. She has one son who is still too small for school. Rice farming and cassava growing are the only primary sources of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for five years. 

This is the fourth microloan for Soklin with VisionFund; now she is leading her group of two women to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and send her son to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is 58 years old. She is married to a soldier and they have five children. To augment her spouse's income she raises hogs and sells them upon attaining the desired weight. 

The family's income is insufficient to sustain all her children's schooling needs. Due to this, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to pay the tuition fees and allowances for her child, Roven. Roven is doing a Bachelor of Arts in Legal Management and wants to become a lawyer someday.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees and allowances for her child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies (fertilizers and pesticides) to care for his crops.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara, who is a 35-year-old young woman, lives in Batumi city, West Georgia. She has two minor children and a husband, who is a private artisan and generates 500 GEL monthly. 

In order to do her bit for the family's welfare and help her husband lead the family more effectively, Gulnara started her own business. She opened a mini-store selling used clothing and purchased stocks of clothing with her saved money. Now Gulnara has requested a loan to reinvest in her business. Her request was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. 

Gulnara will use this loan for purchasing a wide assortment of additional used clothing and expand her business activities. Her income will significantly increase with this start-up program and the loan will greatly assist Gulnara as she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Gulnara has a big list of loyal customers. She will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothing and expand her business activities.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, a 41-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Quezon City, Philippines, has run her market stall for eight years and makes a good income from this. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs, especially for her two children. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

She sells meat, fish, and vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantities of processed meat products, different types of fish, and fresh vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 PHP in sales every day.

Dina is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase more quantities of veggies, stocks of processed meats, and also fish to sell. She will use the loan to improve her sales and use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Dina hopes to expand her stall and, if possible, have the opportunity to operate and manage her own supermarket in the future. She also dreams of having their own house so there is no need for them to always move from one home to another.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fish, meat, vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokhan's Group

texts.en:
Sokhan is aged 37 years and married with three children, living in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bovel district. She and her husband earn a living through growing cassava and farming rice, which they have been in for five years. 

Sokhan has been with VisionFund for two cycles and she successfully used the past loans to better support her family and increase her family’s business. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labourers. 

She hopes to grow her rice successfully and increase her current business to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Yeimi Carolina

texts.es: Yeimi tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 3 años y 11 años de edad. Yeimi se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante y también trabaja en un comedor cercano a su localidad. Yeimi ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una pila con un baño para lo cual necesita materiales como cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava y hierro.
texts.en: Yeimi is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her two daughters, three and 11 years old. Yeimi does traveling clothes sales and also works in a cafeteria near her home. Yeimi has made the decision to request this loan from Kiva partner FUSAI to construct a bathroom. For this, she needs materials such as cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and iron.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, gravel, and iron to construct a bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs and pay for labor to maintain her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married and blessed with three children. She runs a business selling cereals as well as fish to her customers. She has been running this business for the past three years, earning a profit of KES 3,000 per month. 

Lydia has requested a loan of KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase cereals at wholesale to sell to her customers.

Lydia expects to earn a good profit as a result and hence, will be able to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her current business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an electric orange juicer to make his work easier.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a graduate of Makerere University Kampala, where he also worked with CIRCODU (Centre for Integrated Research and Community Development Uganda) as a researcher in clean energy products. He later on moved to a sales and marketing role with Impact Carbon, another clean energy support institution. This role captivated his interest in entrepreneurship.

David is married with two children and takes care of two other extended family members. He believes that as an entrepreneur, his business will enable him to take good care of his family and provide employment to other family members.

The loan will enable his business to grow and become sustainable. The loan will also enable him to meet the demand for his products in rural communities.
 
UpEnergy has provided David with a platform to access good clean energy products. They have enabled him to access clean energy products at affordable prices. Moreover, UpEnergy provides marketing support that can also be transferred to his business customers. The biggest benefit of the energy-efficient cooking stove is that it is environmentally friendly and helps to curb deforestation. 

David's business will encourage people in rural communities to save money and the stoves will help to reduce health risks. David hopes to become a successful businessman, with a self-sustaining business with energy-efficient products.

loans.use: to pay for clean energy-efficient cooking stoves to sell

loans.name: Kan's Group

texts.en:
Kan is 64 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village in Battambang province’s Bovel district. She and her husband have been earning a living through growing rice and cassava for 10 years. The current business earns her about 82,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Kan is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto tiene 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia en el Caserío Playa Azul aproximadamente a 15 minutos del distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población es amable que se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante su unidad vehicular, transportando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, cuenta con clientela fija, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo como limpieza del motor, arreglo de parachoques y de esta manera tener en buenas condiciones su unidad para seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
Edilberto is 58 years old and lives in his own house in the village of Playa Azul, which is approximately 15 minutes from the district of Pucara, a community of warm weather. The population of Playa Azul is friendly and generally works in agriculture, commerce and ranching. The village is in the province of Jaen, which belongs to the Cajamarca region, in Peru's northern mountains.

Edilberto works transporting passengers to nearby areas with his vehicle and has a loyal clientele. He has requested a 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles loan from Edpyme Alernativa and Kiva to maintain his vehicle, including cleaning the motor and fixing the bumper, which will keep his vehicle in good condition and will allow him to continue providing this service.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and maintain its motor.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai, age 28, is living in a rural village in the Dambae district. She has three children. One of her children is in school while the other two are too young for school. She and her husband have been growing cassava for 10 years. She is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day. 

Hai is in her fourth micro loan with VisionFund. She is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her potion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 43 years old. He is married to Leah who supports the family as well through the additional income she provides. Andrea and Leah are blessed with four children between 14 and 5 years old.

Andrea has been in the cereals-selling business for 16 years now and he intends to buy more stock of cereals in bulk.

With the profits from the business, Andrea will continue to expand his business as well as pay school fees for his children. 

He successfully repaid his previous loan. This is his second loan of KES 22,500 from VisionFund Kenya

loans.use: to buy cereals and spices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Sarorn is 40 years old and has five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 20 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.

Phally is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her potion to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma has run a general store for many years to make a living. Aside from this, she also has a farm, their main source of income. Her income goes to their family's daily expenditures and she has to borrow a new loan in order to purchase fertilizer to boost her farm. She has to make sure to improve their farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods to sell. She hopes to support her children in school and see them finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose is a new customer and a resident of Kagarama town board, Ntungamo district. His major activity is farming, especially coffee. He applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. He wants to use the money to mulch his coffee plantation so that he can improve his coffee and banana yields. The challenge has been low productivity in his farming due to poor farming methods, but he believes this will soon be history. His prime target is to yield high output from his plantations. But he is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his dreams. With this loan, he believes his production will improve and his lifestyle will change in society. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor, among other things, to help her coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Seat

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Seat is aged 54 years and married. She has three children. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava for 34 years. The current business earns them about 50,000 KHR per day and manages them to save about 30,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

This is the sixth micro loan for Seat with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to spend on plowing the field. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to spend on plowing the field.

loans.name: Seang Ly's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Seang Ly, 35, has three children in total. Seang Ly and her husband are farmers who have been growing cassava and working for others for a fee. She is able to earn about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. This is the first microloan for Seang Ly with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava. She hopes to grow her cassava and sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en: While her husband earns from working as a carpenter, she manages a cafeteria, which brings a better income to the family.  For five years, the couple has earned well enough to provide for the family. She planned to improve their business in order to send her children to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more raw ingredients to cook food to sell to have higher returns. In the future, she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more raw ingredients to cook food to sell

loans.name: Osanna

texts.en: Osanna is self-employed from Artashat and lives with her husband and two sons. Jointly with her family, Osanna holds a bakery at one of the central streets of the town. They bake about 150 breads per day and sell them to the local population. Now they are planning to make some improvements in their bakery in order to make their job more efficient and profitable. That is why Osanna has applied for a loan of USD 2,500 to renovate their bakery, repair the tandoor, as well as to purchase 20 bags of flour. As this is Osanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to repair the tandoor, buy flour (20 bags), and renovate the bakery.

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Her husband is a carpenter and she runs a retail store in their village to make a living. She has been in the business for five years and she finds it to be a better source of income. She joined GDMPC and has borrowed a new loan to buy additional goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her store  to earn more for their better future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a graduate in computer science from Kyambogo University. He worked with CIRCODU (Center for Integrated Research and Community Development Uganda) as a research officer mainly working in rural communities, sensitizing and distributiong clean energy cookstoves. Later on, he moved on to work as a sales person at Premier Green, another clean energy distribution company, and at Impact Carbon, a clean energy support institution, where he worked as a sales associate. This experience cultivated and motivated his interest to venture into entrepreneurship. 

Michael plans to use his loan to expand his business and generate some profits that will enable him to support his family by building a small house, paying school fees and creating a self-sustaining business. The loan will enable him to reach his target market and to meet the product demand that he has currently been experiencing.

UpEnergy enables Michael to access clean energy cook stoves at affordable prices. UpEnergy gives him flexibility in the range and type of products that meet his tests of different market segments. The biggest benefit of the energy-efficient cooking stoves is that they enable people to save time and money. The products he is selling help improve peoples' welfare through the savings that they make, while they help to protect the environment. 

Michael hopes to have a successful business that reaches people in different rural and semi-urban communities and provides employment to those that aren't able to sort their own business.

loans.use: to pay for clean, energy-efficient stoves to sell

loans.name: Dina's Group

texts.en:
Dina is 51 years old and married with two children. She lives in a rural village of the Damabe district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. Like other villagers, cassava growing has been her family’s main source of income for 3 years. The current business earns her about 38,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Dina has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
Rong is 58 years old living with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Dambae district. Rice farming and cassava growing are the only main source for her family’s income and she has been farming rice for about 38 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 40,000 KHR but she is able to save 20,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Rong with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, Rong wants to use her portion to plow the field. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to plow the field.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vivía con su padre en Magdalena, allí trabajaban juntos en una empresa de fabricación y venta de trapeadoras y escobas. La empresa sufrió un accidente en el que se quemo gran parte de la mercancía, lo poco que lograron recuperar se lo llevaron para Medellín y allí iniciaron de nuevo con el negocio.
Con las esperanzas rotas pero con un corazón firme lograron levantar el negocio nuevamente.
El padre de Carlos falleció hace 4 años legándole el negocio y todo su conocimiento.
Desde entonces ha trabajado muy constantemente en su negocio y siempre con la mirada al frente, hacia sus sueños.
El solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de traperas como madera y retazos.
Con estos elementos podrá capitalizar su negocio y tendrá un mejor producción.
texts.en:
Carlos lived with his father in Magdalena, and there they worked together in a company that manufactured and sold mops and brooms. The company had an accident in which a large part of the merchandise was burned. What little they were able to recover they took with them to Medellín, and there they began again with the business.

With broken hopes but a strong heart, they were able to build up the business yet again. Carlos' father passed away four years ago, leaving behind the business and all of his knowledge with Carlos. Since then he has worked constantly in his business and is always looking ahead toward his dreams.

He is requesting a loan to buy raw materials used to make mops such as wood and fabric. With these materials he will be able to fund his business and will have greater production.

loans.use: to buy materials used to make mops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Bruhani

texts.en: Bruhani is an old customer, aged 36 years old and married with six children. He deals in coffee growing and also has a banana plantation. He has applied for a loan of 3,500,000 UGX. He has a challenge of little income from agriculture and also wants money to buy manure, especially decomposit grass and cowdung so as to get enough output and increase his income. Bruhani will use the profits to educate his children, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to have more income and improve his standard of living. He lives with his wife on the coffee plantation.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Julia Jimena

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 35 años de edad soltera y madre de 2 hijos.
Ella mantiene a su familia realizando negocios de temporada y vive del comercio, su actividad  actual es la venta de ropa.
Julia concluyo la escuela secundaria y le gustan mucho los números es por ese motivo que sin dudarlo dos veces emprendió el negocio actual.
Sus hijos son pequeños (4,8) el mayor asiste a la escuela primaria por las mañanas y por las tardes realiza sus deberes escolares en la tienda de su mamá, el hijo menor juega todo el día mientras su mamá se ocupa de atender la venta de ropa.
Su labor comienza preparando a su hijo mayor para que esté listo a la hora de entrada de la escuela, luego se dirige a su lugar de trabajo para abrir su negocio a las 9am; “mi rutina de lunes a viernes comienza preparando a mi niños para que estén tranquilos el resto de la jornada, el fin de semana ellos duermen hasta más tarde y yo continuo en el negocio todo el día”.
Julia se encarga de cambiar semanalmente la ropa de sus maniquíes para que estén a tono de la moda y así tener una vidriera novedosa continuamente. En el comercio minorista lucha con otras tiendas por el precio y por la moda es por eso que se mantiene informada mediante revistas y tendencias.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de moda por mayor.
texts.en:
Julia is a 35-year-old single woman and the mother of two children. She supports her family by operating seasonal businesses in the retail trade. Her current business involves selling clothes.

Julia finished high school and likes working with numbers. For this reason, she started her current business on two occasions without any hesitation. Her children are young (ages 4 and 8). The oldest child attends elementary school in the mornings and then goes to his mother’s shop in the afternoons to do his homework. The younger child plays all day while his mother is busy selling clothes.

Julia’s day begins when she has to get her older son ready for school. Afterwards, she arrives at her place of work so that she can open her business at 9:00 A.M. “My routine from Monday through Friday begins by preparing my children so that they will behave quietly the rest of the day. On the weekends, they get to sleep late but I have to continue running my business all day,” says Julia.

She changes the clothes on the mannequins on a weekly basis based on what’s fashionable, so her displays are continually updated. Her small business must compete with other stores in terms of price and fashion, so she keeps herself informed by reading magazines and following trends. For this reason, Julia is requesting a loan in order to buy fashionable clothing at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy fashionable clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina esta casada tiene tres hijos y vive en la comunidad de Pacallo en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Agustina trabaja como camarera en un hotel y necesita un prestamo para construir habitaciones en un terreno, Agustina quiere ingresos extras obtenidos de alquileres. Agustina es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Agustina is married and has three children. She lives in a house that she owns made of brick and cement in the community of Pacallo.

Agustina works as a waitress at a hotel and needs a loan so that she can build rooms on her property. She wants to generate extra income from rent. Agustina is the only one earning household income, so she is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to build rental rooms on her property.

loans.name: Desi Seed Producer Company Group

texts.en:
The featured borrower is part of the Desi Seed Producer Company (DSPC). Desi Seed Producer Company is a farmer-driven network of organic seed producers founded on sustainable agricultural practices engaged in the production of traditional food crops seeds, organically. The farms are certified by the Institute for Market Ecology (IMO) agency under the group certification scheme. DSPC works with small and marginal farmers practicing organic farming across Karnataka. They strive to create an uncontested market space for traditional seeds and directly linking them to consumers through public awareness, media and social networking. Farmers and rural bodies like SHGs are involved in post-harvest activities in order to lessen the over-head expenses on the company, and in tandem, generate employment opportunities to enhance sustainable rural business climate.

Praveen (standing with his hand raised) has pursued his B.Sc Plant Biology and MBA Environmental Management from a reputed institution in Tamil Nadu. Since 2012, he has been closely working with seed producers across Karnataka, strengthening community seed supply systems under a SWISSAID project. He is residing in a rented house at Bangalore with his brother while his father and mother stay in a village in Tamil Nadu.

The ten group members require a loan for the procurement and marketing of traditional seeds for an organic village project under the Karnataka Agriculture Dept. A total of 27 hobli (defined as a cluster of adjoining villages administered together for tax and land tenure purposes in the states of Karnataka) require seeds worth Rs.8 lakhs.

loans.use: to procure and market traditional seeds for an organic village project

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 50 years old. She is married with 10 children. She has been selling beans and sorghum for the past four years. She has requested the loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay for the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
En compañía de su esposo, la señora Sandra trabaja en una ferretería como vendedora y en ocasiones como administradora, es un negocio familiar y trabaja activamente por sus hijos.
Ella desea aprovechar una oportunidad de negocio que le ofrece su esposo y consiste en el inicio de una tienda de pinturas al lado de la ferretería de su esposo. Manifiesta que será un negocio muy rentable ya que ya llevan mucho tiempo en la zona y son reconocidos por su buen servicio y calidad de productos.
Ella es una mujer muy preparada y tiene todas las pilas puestas para emprender con este nuevo proyecto en el cual tiene mucha fe.
Ella solicita ayuda para la compra de estanterías, realizar mejoras y adecuaciones al local y comprara surtido de pinturas en diferentes marcas.
Este nuevo negocio impactara favorablemente su economía y aumentara las ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra and her husband have a hardware store where she works as a salesperson. On occasion, she acts as the manager. It is a family business and she remains active at her work on behalf of her children.

Sandra and her husband want to take advantage of a business opportunity that has been offered to them, which is to open a paint shop next to the hardware store. She says that it will be a very profitable business because she has been in the area for a long time and her family is known for providing good service and quality products.

Sandra is well-prepared and has already laid out the foundation that is needed to start this new venture in which she has placed a great deal of faith. She is requesting a loan in order to buy shelving, do some remodeling and improvements to the shop, and to purchase a stock of paints of different brands. This new business will favorably impact her finances and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy shelving, make improvements, and acquire inventory for the paint shop located next to her existing hardware store.

loans.name: Yeldy Hayde

texts.es: Yeldy tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 7 años y 11 años de edad. Yeldy se dedica a comercio de variedad de productos como: joyería, cosméticos y lociones. La venta la hace de forma ambulante y es así como lleva el sustento a su familia y mantiene la economía del hogar. Yeldy desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de pintura, cemento, arena y una puerta puesto que desea pintar y repellar las paredes de la vivienda y cambiar la puerta.
texts.en:
Yeldy is 33 years old and resides in her own home with her two children, ages 7 and 11. She is a merchant who sells various products such as jewelry, cosmetics, and lotions. Her sales are conducted as a street vendor, which is how she is able to support her family and maintain the household finances.

Yeldy wants to improve the conditions in her home, so she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of paint, cement, and a door. Yeldy wants to paint and plaster the walls of her home, as well as replace the existing door.

loans.use: to buy a replacement door, as well as paint and cement for the walls of her home.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa es soltera y tiene un hijo ella vive en la comunidad de Pacallo en unja casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Teresa trabaja como cocinera en un restaurant pero tambien tiene un negocio propio Teresa necesita un prestamo para comprar mas insumos para su negocio personal de venta de cafe y miel artesanal Teresa es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Teresa is single and has a child. She lives in a rented house made of brick and cement in the community of Pacallo.

Teresa works as a cook at a restaurant, but she also has her own business. She needs a loan in order to buy more supplies for her business of selling coffee and artisanal honey. Teresa is the only one earning income for her household, so she is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business of selling coffee and artisanal honey.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Ermelinda tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad de clima variado que cuenta con los servicios de luz y agua, que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bodega y crianza de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción que permitan ampliar su bodega y de esta manera poder tener en mejores condiciones sus productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ermelinda is 45 years old and lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community with a diverse climate that has water and electric services. The people make a living in agriculture, commerce and livestock in this district located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. Ermelinda makes a living selling goods at her bodega and raising farm animals. Her business is located in the back of her home. She is requesting the loan to purchase construction materials that will allow her to expand her bodega and in this way she can have better conditions to offer her products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand her store.

loans.name: Rosa Gladis

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella siempre ha buscado como generar ingresos y hace 5 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, cremas, champú, desinfectantes, tintes, etc. Los productos que compra son de catalogo y vende por pedidos de sus clientes. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras para comprar más productos para la venta como tintes, cremas, desodorantes,  lociones y apoyar a su esposo quien se dedica a las actividades agrícolas. Su propósito es crecer en clientes para aumentar las ganancias y ayudar a sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old, married, and has four children. She resides in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Rosa is always looking for ways to generate income, so five years ago, she decided to sell cosmetics, crèmes, shampoo, disinfectants, dyes, and other items. She buys these products through catalogs and sells them by taking orders from her customers.

Rosa is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL in order to buy more products to sell such as dyes, crèmes, deodorants, and lotions. She will also help her husband who engages in farming activities. Her goal is to grow her clientele so that she can increase her earnings and help her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy dyes, crèmes, deodorants, and lotions to sell.

loans.name: Hilda Isabel

texts.es:
Hilda Isabel tiene 31 años de edad, vive junto con su esposo e hijos en su propia casa en el Distrito de Zaña, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y animales menores como gallinas, patos y pavos, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de animales menores y alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos que le permitan ofrecer sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda Isabel is 31 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and children in the District of Zaña. This community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Hilda raises cattle and small animals such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys. Her business is located in an area behind her home. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 4,000 PEN so that she can buy small animals and balanced feed for fattening them. This will enable her to have animals that she can offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy small animals and balanced feed.

loans.name: Marly Patricia

texts.es: Marly es una joven de 22 años de edad que ha vivido gran parte de su vida en el campo, es madre de una hija de 6 años de edad, y quiere iniciar su propios cultivos en su hogar, empezar con algo pequeño esperando cómo evoluciona su idea de negocio pues busca tener una mejor estabilidad económica para ella, su pareja y su bebe y buscando una forma de vida que le permita darse sus gustos y cubrir gastos personales proyectando su negocio como un gran cultivo capas de proveer una plaza de mercado. Necesita un apoyo económico para iniciar su negocio comprando semillas y riegos que ella misma va a plantar pues al vivir toda la vida en el campo ha adquirido conocimientos para realizar esta actividad. Sueña con remodelar su hogar y ofrecer a su hijo una vida más cómoda
texts.en:
Marly, 22, has lived for most of her life in the countryside.  She is the mother of a six-year-old child.  

She wants to start her own plantations in her home, starting with something small and seeing how it grows.  This business idea is so that she can have more economic stability for her family, and be able treat herself and cover personal expenses.  

She would like to expand the business eventually and sell her produce on a market stall. 

She needs financial aid to start her business by buying seeds and irrigation tools.  She is going to plant them herself because, after living in the countryside all her life, she has acquired the necessary skills. 

She dreams of refurbishing her home and providing her son with a more comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: to start up her business buying seeds and irrigation tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Jiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jiguiya est  majoritairement composé  de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de,chaussures plastiques de toutes sortes, habits, restauration et pots. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia(femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des chaussures plastiques de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100 paires de chaussures en gros au grand marché.La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Kadia espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Jiguiya group consists predominantly of monogamous women. They are on average 43 years old with seven children. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in all kinds of plastic shoes, clothing, food and pots.

To increase their stock supply, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their third group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Kadia (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling  all kinds of plastic shoes. She intends to use her loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes at wholesale prices at the main market. Retail sales are conducted in Djalakorodji to mainly women customers.

Mrs. Kadia hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business.

She aims to buy a lot for residential use through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy all kinds of plastic shoes

loans.name: Hebert

texts.es:
Hebert tiene 25 años de edad, vive con su familia que cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz) en una comunidad pequeña de Buenos Aires, sus pobladores se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, comercio y agricultura, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte público mediante su mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros por zonas aledañas a su distrito, junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza de animales menores y comercio de plátanos, son una familia emprendedora que se esfuerzan en la labore que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Hebert, 25, lives with his family in a house which has running water and electricity.  The house is in a small community in Buenos Aires where the people work raising small animals, trading and agriculture.  This community is located in the Morropon province of the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.

He offers a public transport service using his motorcycle taxi.  He takes his passengers to other parts of the district.  Together with his wife, he also raises small animals and sells bananas.  They are a very enterprising family who work hard every day.  

He has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 nuevos soles to buy animal feed to fatten up his animals and as a result, sell them at a better price.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico junto con su conyugue y su menor hijo de 4 años de edad, en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante su mototaxi, contando con unidad propia trasladando a sus pasajeros por zonas aledañas a su distrito, es conocido en el medio donde vive, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de gallinas y una segunda parte para arreglos de su vehículo que le permitirá seguir brindando este servicio sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Jose, 41, lives in his own rustic house with his wife and young son who is four.  They live in the Pucara district; a place where most people work in agriculture, trade or livestock.  It is located in the Jaen province, in Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

He has a public transport service, using his motorcycle taxi to take passengers to other parts of his town.  He is well-known in the area where he lives.  

He has asked for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 nuevos soles.  He is going to use part of it to buy some hens and the other part to make some repairs to his vehicle which will allow him to continue to offer his service without any problems.

loans.use: to make repairs to his vehicle and to buy some hens.

loans.name: Moises Anthony

texts.es: Moises tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hermana y un sobrino de un años de edad. Moises trabaja como empleado en una institución cercana a su localidad y es así como se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Moises ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un muro de retención para el cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Espera poder contar con este crédito y así poder dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Moises, 27, lives in his own house with his sister and a one-year-old nephew. He works as an employee in a local institution which provides him with an income to help with the household expenses. 

He has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI because he wants to build a retaining wall, so he needs to buy material such as cement, sand, bricks and iron.   

He hopes to receive this loan so he can start building as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks and iron to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna lives in Goris with her husband and works in Goris hospital as a nurse. She is the only working person in the family. In order to make ends meet, Susanna and her husband are engaged in beekeeping. They already have 10 bee colonies and now want to expand their agribusiness. For this reason, Susanna has applied for a loan of USD 300 to purchase 4 new bee colonies and 40 honeycombs. Susanna and her husband really want to improve their financial situation. They will appreciate any kind of support. Let's help them to grow their agribusiness and become more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy 4 bee colonies and 40 honeycombs

loans.name: Takaprin Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Takaprin est constitué de huit femmes  tous mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 46ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tel que la vente du bois de chauffage, restauration, habits, condiments et produits cosmétiques.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Massaba (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffe. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 chargement du bois de chauffage en gros. Elle s’approvisionne du bois de chauffage dans les villages environnant de Bamako.La revente s’effectue à Djicoroni au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Massaba compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Takaprin group consists of eight women, all married and living in polygamous households. They are on average 46 years old with four children. They all live in Djicoroni, one of Bamako's neighborhoods. They became acquainted through local tontines (savings groups) and their income-generating activities.

Group members run businesses such as selling firewood, food preparations, clothing, condiments and cosmetics. To increase their stock in trade, the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second group loan.

Mrs. Massaba (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling firewood. She intends to use this loan to buy one load of firewood wholesale. She gets her firewood from villages surrounding Bamako. Retail sales take place in Djicoroni, for cash to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Mrs. Massaba expects to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs, which will be used to meet her children's small needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in her business activities.

She relies greatly on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to achieve her objective of expanding her business.

loans.use: buy firewood

loans.name: Bukaluba Sibutankdikeko Group

texts.en:
The Bukaluba Sibutankdikeko group is located in a rural area and has 10 members: Joseph, Paul, Willy, Juliet, Costa, Agnes, Sarah, Ronmary, Pius and Fred. They are involved in different activities including farming, retail, passion fruit farming, produce trading, market vending, local brewing and textiles.

Joseph is the group's featured borrower. He has his hand raised in the photo. He is a married man, 45 years old, with six children, four of whom attend school. He deals in local brewing and he does farming as a side business. He started his brewing business in 1996 in order to improve his standard of living and to pay school fees for his children. His clients are people from the surrounding area. 

Joseph's major challenges are the lack of sufficient working capital and clients who take too long to pay their debts. As a result, he acquired this loan to boost his businesses. His hope is to one day buy a plot for his family, educate his children and grow his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for farming and brewing

loans.name: Gnetaga Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Gnetaga est  majoritairement composé  de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 42ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (gombos), habits, restauration et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Doussouba(femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (gombos). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20sacs de gombos en gros à Médine.La revente se fait en détails à Djalakorodji et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Doussouba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Gnetaga group consists predominantly of polygamous women. They are on average 42 years old with seven children. They all live in Djalakorodji, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in condiments (gombos), clothing, food preparations and charcoal.

To increase their stock supply, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Doussouba (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling condiments (gombos). She intends to use her loan to buy 20 bags of gombos at wholesale prices in Medine. Retail sales are conducted in Djalakorodji to mainly women customers.

Mrs. Doussouba hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business.

She aims to buy a lot for residential use through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Alakabo Group

texts.fr:
Composé de cinq femmes, les membres du groupe Alakabo sont majoritairement mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 30ans et 3enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente du bois de chauffage, de condiments, de tubercules du charbon de bois.Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Korotoumou(femme assise au milieu devant sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement du bois de charbon dans les villages environnant de Bamako.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit  et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes à Djalakorodji. Madame Korotoumou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 130 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women members of the Alakabo Group are married and live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 30 years old and have three children.  The women live in Djalakorodji, a neighbourhood of Bamako.  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and business connections.  The group members sell firewood, food, tubers and charcoal.

All the women want to build up their stock holding so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Korotoumou (sitting in the middle of the photo) has a strong reputation for selling firewood.  She plans to use her loan to buy one load of firewood from the villages surrounding Bamako.  She will resell it for cash or on credit to women in Djalakorodji.  Sometimes she takes orders for wood.

Korotoumou expects to make an average monthly profit of 130,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for the school and healthcare costs of her children.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Composé de sept femmes, les membres du groupe Danaya sont  majoritairement mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djalakorodji l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente de, condiments (gombos), produits cosmétiques,habits, charbon du bois et bois de chauffages.Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia(femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (gombo). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 sacs de gombo. Elles s’approvisionnent en condiment à Médine. La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes à Djalakorodji. Madame Rokia compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 125 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Danaya Group are married and live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 35 years old, have three children and live in Djalakorodji, a district of Bamaka.  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and business connections.  The women sell food (gumbo), cosmetic products, clothing, charcoal and firewood.

As the group members would like to increase their stock holding, they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Rokia (sitting second from the left in the photo) is a well-known retailer of food (gumbo).  She plans to use her loan to buy 20 sacks of gumbo from Médine.  She will resell it on foot in Djalakorodji, to women, for cash or on credit.  Rokia expects to make an average monthly profit of 125,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for healthcare costs for her children.  She is working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Alba Desire

texts.fr:
Mr ALBA DESIRE est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. L’enfant  a 02ans et ne va pas à l’école. Mr a 04 personnes en charge.
Mr vend des habits et chaussures depuis 04ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier.
Il veut s’acheter 20paires de chemises, 20paires de pantalons et 12paires de chaussures.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité en ouvrant une autre boutique. Il ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle pour lui et sa famille et accroitre son activité.
texts.en: Alba Desire is married and the father of one child. His child is 2 years old and does not go to school. Alba Desire has 4 dependents. He has been selling clothes and shoes for 4 years. He gets his supplies at the market in his district. He wants to buy 20 pairs of shirts, 20 pairs of trousers and 12 pairs of shoes. He would like to use his profits to expand his business by opening another shop. He aims to buy a plot of land for himself and his family and to increase his business.

loans.use: to buy 20 pairs of shirts, 20 pairs of trousers and 12 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Kankeletiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kankeletiguiya est composé de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 31ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits de meilleures qualités, de fruits, de biscuits et du charbon de bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djénèbou (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 pièces d’habits en gros au grand marché.La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou et à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Djénèbou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
