The Kankeletiguiya group consists of four women, for the most part married in monogamous households. They are on average 31 years old with three children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in quality clothing, fruit, biscuits and charcoal.

To increase their business stock, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle.

Mrs. Djénèbou (the woman sitting on the far left in the photo) has a great reputation at selling quality clothing. She intends to use her loan to buy 40 clothing items at wholesale prices at the main market. Retail sales are conducted in Niomirambougou to mainly women customers.

Mrs. Djénèbou hopes to achieve with this loan an average monthly profit of 80,000 CFA francs to be reinvested in the business.

She aims to buy a lot for residential use through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: buy clothing

loans.name: Tagne Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement  dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Tagnè ont en moyenne 28 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Niomirambougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Niomirambougou.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, grains d’arachides et  habits.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adjaratou (femme assise en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains d’arachide.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une corbeille de tomate, une corbeille de piment,
 1 sac d’aubergine et 3 sacs de grains d’arachides à Médine.La revente se fait en détails à Niomirambougou et à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Adjaratou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married only into polygamous households, the four members of the Tagnè group are on average 28 years old with two children. They all live in Niomirambougou, one of Bamako's neighborhoods, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties and their income-generating activities at the Niomirambougou market.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in groundnut kernels and clothes. To increase their business stock, the group decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are in their second group loan cycle. 

Mrs. Adjaratou (the woman sitting in the second position from left to right in the photo) is a great seller of groundnut kernels. She intends to use her loan to buy one basket of tomatoes, one basket of chili peppers, one bag of eggplants and three bags of groundnut kernels in Medine. Retail sales are conducted in Niomirambougou to a clientele composed mostly of women.

Madame Adjaratou hopes this loan will bring her average monthly profits of 60,000 CFA francs, to be reinvested in the business and used to meet the household's small needs.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Laïdou est constitué de quatre femmes majoritairement  mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pommes de terre, lait en poudre, et habits.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ier prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Sallé(femme debout en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pommes de terre. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 4 sacs pommes de terre. Elle s’approvisionne  à Médine.La revente s’effectue à Lafiabougou au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sallé compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group is made up of 4 women, most of whom are married and live in monogamous households. They have an average age of 41 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of Bamako's districts. They got to know each other via savings groups located in their district and via their revenue-generating activities. The members of the group are small retailers of potatoes, powdered milk and clothing. The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their first group loan.

Sallé (the woman standing second from the left in the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of potatoes. She plans to use this loan to buy 4 bags of potatoes. She gets her supplies in Médine. She makes her sales in Lafiabougou for cash to a clientèle mostly made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Sallé expects to make an average monthly profit of 40 000 francs, part of which will be used to meet her children's small needs and part of which will be reinvested in her business. Sallé is counting on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to enable her to achieve her goal, which is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy blocks, cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Sabou Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Sabou sont équitablement  mariées et vie dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 35 ans et  5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Lafiabougou l’un des quartiers de Bamako. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe mènent des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’oignons, de savons, du jus et de céréales.Dans  le souci d’élargir leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Sirabou(femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété dans la vente de l’oignon à Lafiabougou. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs d’oignons. Elles s’approvisionnent à Médine.  Elle mène ses activités au comptant à Lafiabougou et à une clientèle de femmes. Madame Sirabou compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Sabou group is made up of 4 women who are all married and live in polygamous and monogamous households. They have an average age of 35 and, on average, 5 children. They all live in Lafiabougou, one of Bamako's districts. They got to know each other through savings groups located in their district and their revenue-generating activities. The members of the group have different revenue-generating activities, selling onions, soaps, juice and cereals. The group members decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses and are on their first group loan.

Sirabou (the woman sitting on the left in the picture) has a good reputation as a seller of onions in Lafiabougou. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 bags of onions. She gets her supplies in Médine. She makes her sales in Lafiabougou for cash to a clientèle made up of women. Thanks to this loan, Sirabou expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs, part of which will be used to meet her needs and part of which will be reinvested in her business. Sirabou's goal is to strengthen her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to benefit from many loans.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of onions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine and carry out lab tests.

loans.name: Bedriyasso Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Bedriyasso ont en moyenne 27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de qualités supérieures. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Niagalé (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits(pagnes wax) de qualités supérieures.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au  grand marché.La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Niagalé compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
All the four women of the Bedriyasso Group are married into monogamous households.  They are, on average, 27 years old, have three children and live in Kanadjiguila in the commune of Mandé, Kati county.  They know one another through neighbourhood and business connections at the Kanadjiguila market.  The women sell high quality clothing (wax pagnes - traditional, wrap-around clothing).

As the women would all like to increase their working capital, they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Niagalé (sitting on the far right in the photo) is a well-known retailer of high quality wax pagnes.  She plans to use her loan to buy 20 wax pagnes, wholesale from the main market.  She will resell them on foot in Kanadjiguila to women customers.

Niagalé expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Damou Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de quatre femmes, les membres du groupe Damou sont majoritairement mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge 34ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures qualités, de céréales, de restauration et du charbon de bois.Dans  le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une bonne réputation dans la vente d’habits (pagnes wax) de meilleures.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako.La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes à Kanadjiguila. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer la scolarisation et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The four women members of the Damou Group are married into monogamous households.  They are, on average, 34 years old, have four children and live in Kanadjiguila in Mandé commune, Kati county.  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and business connections.  The women sell high quality clothing (wax pagnes - traditional, wrap-around clothing), cereals, catering and charcoal.

As the women would like to increase their sales revenue, they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Fatoumata (standing on the left in the photo) has a good reputation for selling high quality wax pagnes.  She plans to use her loan to buy 10 wax pagnes from Bamako.  She will resell them on foot in Kanadjiguila, to women, for cash or on credit.  Sometimes she takes orders for clothing.

Fatoumata expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, which she will use to pay for school and healthcare costs for her children.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Cristian Leonardo

texts.es:
Cristian es un hombre preocupado por los demás, vive en unión estable con 3 hijos a los que le brinda el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, labora en una alcaldía de la localidad donde vive, desempeñándose como Director de oficina de gestión de riesgo con un año de laborar en esa área,  actualmente tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda atravez de un préstamo el cual lo solicito en ceprodel quien le dio respuesta positiva, ya que lo utilizara en la Compra de Cemento, Arena, Inodoro y Mano de Obra.
El que le bridara mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Cristian is a man concerned for others.  He lives in a stable relationship with three children who he supports in what they need for their development.  He works in the local city hall as the director of risk management, which he has been doing for a year.  Currently he wants to carry out home improvements and is requesting a loan through CEPRODEL which he will use to buy cement, sand, a toilet and hire workers.  This will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, and a toilet and hire workers.

loans.name: Gs Song Taaba Rabele Group

texts.fr: GS Song taaba rabele est un bon groupe qui travaille avec ACFIME depuis 2009. Ce groupe de trois femmes battantes est toujours à jour pour leur remboursement. Leur domaine d'activité c'est le commerce de détails et la restauration. SAFIATA, mariée et mère de trois(03) enfants est l'emprunteur représentatif de ce groupe. Elle vend du charbon depuis 06 ans et avec son commerce, elle arrive a aider son mari qui est commerçant aussi, ensemble ils scolarisent leurs enfants. En plus, Safiata a un employé qui l'aide à vendre. Avec ce prêt, elle veut acheter du charbon et stocker pour vendre en cette saison pluvieuse où ce n'est pas facile de trouver du bon charbon. En effet, elle rendra un service énorme à beaucoup de ménages. Enfin avec le bénéfice, elle va commencer à préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: The Song Taaba Rebele solidarity group is a good group that has been working with ACFIME since 2009. This group of 3 hardworking women always repays on time. Their businesses are in the commerce and restaurant sectors. Safiata is married and the mother of three (3) children, and is the featured borrower for this group. She has been selling charcoal for the past 6 years and with her business, she is able to help her husband, who also works in commerce. Together, they educate their children. Also, Safiata employs one person who helps her with her sales. With this loan, she wants to purchase charcoal to stock and sell during the rainy season, when it is not easy to find good quality charcoal. She will consequently be able to provide help to a large number of households. With her profits, she will start to prepare for the school year for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to stock and sell during the rainy season

loans.name: Djamanadia Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe Djamanadia est constitué de six femmes  toutes mariées et vivant équitablement dans des ménages polygamiques et monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du  Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font du commerce,  tels que la vente de, condiments,bois de chauffage, habits, ustensiles et charbon du bois. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de rejoindre  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1 er prêt en prêt solidaire.
Madame Saran (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’oignons. Elles s’approvisionnent  à Médine.La revente s’effectue à Kanadjiguila au comptant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Saran compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé pour satisfaire les petits besoins de ses enfants et investir le reste dans ses activités. Madame compte beaucoup sur le partenariat de Soro Yiriwaso pour l’atteinte de ses objectifs qui est l’élargissement de son activité.
texts.en:
The Djamanadia Group is made up of six married women who live equally in polygamous and monogamous households.  They are, on average, 33 years old, have five children and live in Kanadjiguila, commune of Mandé, Kati county.  They know one another through local savings groups and their business connections.  The women sell food, firewood, clothing, cooking utensils and charcoal.

As all the women would like to increase their working capital, they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first group loan.

Saran (standing on the left in the photo) is well-known for selling food (onions).  She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of onions in Médine.  She will resell the onions to women in Kanadjiguila, for cash or on credit.

Saran expects to make an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and provide for some of the needs of her children.  She is relying on her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to enable her to achieve her goal of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Kodon Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de six femmes, les membres du groupe Kodon sont toutes mariés dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont une moyenne  d’âge de 42ans et 4enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des liaisons de parenté, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe font la vente de, pommes de terre, condiments, habits et jarres.Dans  le souci de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Maïmouna (femme debout en 3ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pommes de terre.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3sacs de pommes de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent en pommes de terre à Médine.  La revente se fait au comptant ou à crédit en ambulant et parfois par commande à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Maïmouna compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour assurer les soins de santé des enfants. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Made up of six women, the members of the Kodon Group are all married and live in monogamous households.  They are, on average, 42 years old, have four children and live in Kanadjiguila, commune of Mandé, Kati county.  They know one another through family, neighbourhood and business connections.  The women sell potatoes, food ingredients, clothing and jars.

The women would all like to build up their stock holding, so they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Maïmouna (standing third from the right in the photo) is well-know for selling potatoes.  She plans to use her loan to buy three sacks of potatoes from Médine.  She will resell them on foot, to women, for cash or on credit.  Sometimes she takes orders for potatoes.

Maïmouna expects to make an average monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to provide for the healthcare costs of her children.  She hopes that this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso will help her achieve her aim of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Pacha  (Nabón) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Paccha se encuentra está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por los alrededores del Cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene una geografía muy accidentada y su clima es frió. Su gente es amable, gentil, tienen un corazón cálido y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, en su mayor parte se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, cría de animales y muchos salen diariamente a laborar en la ciudad en donde ejercen varias actividades las que le permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora María, este grupo le gusta por la amistad y la solidaridad que existe entre todas ellas, los créditos le han permitido inyectar capital a su actividad económica. 
La Señora María tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, 3 estudian, trabajan y le ayuda económicamente, uno de sus hijos estudia por la tarde en el colegio, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña María se dedica a las tareas del campo, cultiva y lo que cosecha es para su casa y también vende,  también cría ganado, gallinas, cuyes y ovejas. En su casa vende plantas hornamentales. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Paccha is comprised of eight women members and one man who live in the Nabón Canton, which is a mountainous area with a cold climate.  The people here are kind and gentle and keep to the culture and traditions of their villages.  Most people work in agriculture and livestock farming, and many work in the city where they carry out different businesses in order to improve their economic stability.

One of the members of the group is María who enjoys the friendship and solidarity between the members, as well as the loans that have allowed her to invest in her business.

Maria is 48 years old, married and has seven children.  Three of them are married and live independently, three attend school and work to help out economically, and one of her sons studys at school in the afternoons.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and they live in their own home.

Maria works in agriculture and grows crops for home consumption and also to sell.  She also raisies cattle, chickens, guinea pigs and sheep.  At home she sells ornamental plants.  The loan she has requested will be used to buy compost for her crops.

loans.use: To buy compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for his driver's licence.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina Diane is chasing a big dream: She started a newspaper. Earlier this year, she started publishing The Community Press, which is based in the city of Elsa, Texas and covers the local community news for the Rio Grande Valley. Her company is on Facebook and Twitter.

Rina Diane describes her company this way: “The Community Press is here to promote the progress and growth of the Delta Area that adds to the identity and pride of the community, record the history of this area and its people, and make differences in the quality of life for the residents and merchants. The Community Press is dedicated to encourage community service among citizens and employees, recognizing that the more they are involved with the community, the better they will be able to understand and serve it.”

Currently, The Community Press publishes 5,000 copies bi-weekly and is distributed throughout the Delta Area, and is free to readers. The publication earns $2,000 to $4,000 in advertising sales per month. To grow and improve the product, Rina Diane needs to lease office space and hire two part-time employees to help bring in more revenue. She turned to Accion Texas this spring for a $5,000 loan.

loans.use: to lease office space and hire two part-time employees for her local newspaper in her local town.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Solidarias, vive en el cantón de Paute  que es de clima templado donde se produce una gran variedad de frutas y flores.
La Señora Claudia tiene 20 años de edad, está casada y a un no ha concebido hijos, su esposo se dedica a la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre compartiendo gastos. 
Doña Claudia se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar, pero para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de cuyes y aves de corral, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de alimento para animales y materiales de construcción para construir su casa. Su meta es terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Claudia is a part of the Mujeres Solidarias credit group. She lives in the Paute canton. It has a template climate and produces a wide variety of fruit and flowers.  

Claudia is 20 years old. She is married and has no children yet. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She doesn't own her own home and they live with her mother, sharing expenses. Claudia takes care of the home, but to contribute to the household budget she raises guinea pigs and poultry. She also farms for household consumption and if there is any left over, she sells it. The money from the loan is to buy animal feed and construction materials to build her house. Her goal is to finish construction on her house.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Leticia

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Solidarias, vive en el cantón de Paute  que es de clima templado donde se produce una gran variedad de frutas y flores.
La Señora Rosa tiene 53 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, 2 son casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijas solteras trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Rosa es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a los quehaceres del campo como es la crianza de animales y la agricultura, también tiene una tienda donde trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo. Estas actividades le han permitido sacar adelante a toda su familia y ofrecerles un mejor porvenir. Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad de todas sus amigas.
texts.en:
Rosa is a part of the Mujeres Solidarias credit group. She lives in the Paute canton, which has a template climate and produces a wide variety of fruits and flowers.  

Rosa is 53 years old. She is married and from her marriage has produced 4 children. Two are married and on their own. Her two single daughters work and help financially. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer and they own the house they live in. Rosa is a hardworking woman who does country work like raising animals and farming. She also has a store where she works every day without a set schedule. These activities have allowed her to get her whole family ahead and offer them a better future. Her new loan will be invested in buying grocery items for her store. She likes her credit group because of the support from all her friends.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oi, rice and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and more.

loans.name: Betania Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a mother of two schooling kids and is married. She was born in the 1970s and has had good experience with her business for twenty years. She runs a low-class food business (mamalishe). She depends on this business to raise her income and support her family. Mwanaisha serves fresh juices made of different fruits that she prepares herself. She serves people from 7:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good return per month. 

She decided to request another loan (her eighth) from Tujijenge Tanzania to keep improving her business and keep having the income she needs to survive with her family. She will use the loan to replenish her food ingredients, especially cooking oil and a sack of baking flour, to prepare for the coming Muslim fasting period. 

She used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to keep her business with food ingredients, and also bought a business fridge. Mwanaisha earned a profit, which she used to cover school fees and home expenses. She dreams of being a successful woman.

Mwanaisha will share this loan with her loan group "Betania", which totals four women. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her food ingredients, especially cooking oil and a sack of baking flour, to prepare for the coming Muslim fasting period.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a married man blessed with four children. He is in the manufacturing sector, where he makes charcoal stoves, commonly referred to as “jiko”, in Kenya. He has requested for a loan of Ksh. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase more raw materials for making the jikos.

With the profits from the loan, he will be able to purchase food for his family and repay his loan, as well as expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making charcoal stoves, "jikos".

loans.name: Arpine

texts.en:
Arpine is a farmer from Sarnakunk village of Syunik region. She lives with her husband, grandfather, and two sons. Jointly with her family members, Arpine has been engaged in agriculture for 20 years already. 

Arpine's family owns various types of agricultural machinery and cultivates potatoes, beans, corn, and other types of grains. The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function in a more efficient way. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling them to repair their machinery, purchase diesel fuel, and pay for 35 bags of fertilizers and 500 kg potato seeds. 

As this is Arpine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to repair agricultural machinery, purchase diesel fuel, and pay for fertilizers (35 bags) and potato seeds (500 kg).

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old. She is married with five children. She sells various items and has been in the business for the past two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, cooking oil and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans, cooking oil and salt for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase local food (foo-foo) and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en: Louise is 21 years old. She sells different items in her business. She would wish to buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar to sell. She will reinvest her profits in the business.

loans.use: To buy more flour, cooking oil and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Adarton

texts.en:
Adarton is a repeat customer, a resident of Cell4, Ntungamo district. His major activity is farming especially coffee farming. He applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000. He wants to use the money to mulch his coffee and banana plantation such that he can improve his output in the next season. He has a challenge of low production in his farming due to poor farming methods. 

His prime target is to get a higher output from his plantations, also to take his children to better schools. But he is limited by low capital and lack of funds to enable him achieve his dreams. With this loan he believes his production will improve and his life style will change in the society. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the job well done.

loans.use: To buy mulch.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is aged 54. She is married with three children. With the loan, she wants to buy more sorghum for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase local snacks and palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 37 years old. He is the father of four children who go to school. 

With the loan, he wants to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt for sale.

loans.name: Rida's Group

texts.en:
Rida, a single man residing in Bovel district, is a farmer who struggles for a living via rice farming and a paid-working job. This is the business that he has had for ten years. 

This is not the first loan for Rida with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He has repaid his past loan completely, and it has enabled him to uplift his lifestyle at a gradual pace. 

Now, Rida leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his entire loan portion to buy seed for his cash crop. He highly hopes that he can gain a good yield, better than before.

loans.use: to buy seed for his cash crop.

loans.name: Slivestre

texts.en:
Silvestre is a hardworking entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines. He is 46 years old and has two children who are currently in school. He oversees the operation of their Jeepney unit, and his income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenditures.

He has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) Jeepney, from which he is paid *boundary (daily quota) each day. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,500 every day. 

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater Jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the Jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Philippine.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the Jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

Silvestre is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan assistance to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. He will use the profit to improve the general living conditions of his family.

In the future, he hopes that his business will be continuously operating and growing. He dreams that his children will finish their studies and that they shall have sufficiency in everything.

He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney unit.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and blessed with five children aged between 13 years and 9 years. She operates a money transfer business, commonly referred to as “M-pesa”. 

Joyce has requested a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to expand her business by purchasing M-pesa float. She gets a monthly income of KES 45,000.

loans.use: to add float to her M-pesa money transfer business.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en:
Peruth is aged 30. She is a mother of five children. 

She owns a bar and has been in the business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beer and sodas for resale. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more beer and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José tiene 41 años, es un productor de café de una comunidad rural de Estelí, donde vive con su compañera y sus tres hijos. Parte de su tiempo la dedica a la producción de café que ha establecido en 1.4 hectáreas de las 21.83 hectáreas de su finca, la cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

En los últimos tres años la producción de café de este pequeño productor ha pasado de 31 a 99 quintales de café.   Para este año, él está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal y garantizar su implementación de manera oportuna. Su meta es incrementar los rendimientos de su café y tener mayores ingresos para mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 41 years old. He is a producer of coffee in the rural community of Estelí where he lives with his partner and their three children. Part-time he is in the production of coffee for a living which he has established on 1.4 hectares of his 21.83 hectare farm, which he runs under the criteria of fair trade certification.

In the last three years of production of coffee from this small producer he has gone from 31 to 99 bushels of coffee. For this year, he is requesting a loan to buy supplies that his coffee crops need and to ensure timely implementation. His goal is to increase the yields of his coffee and to have better income to improve the economic conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Solidarias y este es su tercer crédito. Vive en el cantón de Paute que es de clima templado donde se produce una gran variedad de frutas y flores.
La Señora María tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda, fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, tres de sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la localidad. 
Doña María se dedica a la cría de aves de corral, cuyes y cerdos, también labora en la dura tarea de la agricultura y sus frutos son para su consumo y también para la venta. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de pollos y e alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
María, 62, is part of the Mujeres Solidarias credit group and this is her third loan.  She lives in Paute Canton, where the climate is temperate and a wide variety of fruits and flowers is produced.

María is a widow; she had six children from her marriage.  Two of them are married and live on their own.  Three of her single children help her economically.  Her youngest son attends school in the town.

María makes a living raising fowl, guinea pigs, and pigs.  She also works in the difficult task of farming.  Her crops are for her consumption and for sale.

The money from her loan is to buy chickens and animal feed.  Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish.

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. Her husband works as a businessman. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil.

loans.name: Nam's Group

texts.en:
Nam is 46 years old and a villager of Phnom Proek district. She has four children. As she struggles to make a living, she does rice farming and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years. 

This is the original loan for Nam with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). She and her joint borrower are seeking 200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion of loan to buy some household products to meet the family's needs. She highly believes that the loan will allow her to live in a better condition.

loans.use: to buy some household products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food containers, cups, and knives to expand her business.

loans.name: Jeronimo Remigio

texts.es:
Jerónimo es un productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en una finca de 9.5 hectáreas, de las cuales 1.4 hectáreas ha destinado para el cultivo del café, el cual maneja bajo procesos de certificación de comercio justo.

Para este año, este productor está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos que requiere su cafetal, a fin de lograr una buena cosecha este ciclo. Para los próximos años, él se ha propuesto mejorar las condiciones de su finca y con ellos los ingresos para dar un nivel de vida más digno a su familia. Está seguro que con las inversiones que haga en su cafetal irá mejorando sus condiciones económicas.
texts.en: Jeronimo is a coffee producer, who lives in a rural community North of Nicaragua. He lives with his wife and their 3 children in a 9.5 hectare farm, from which 1.4 hectares are intended for growing coffee, which he manages under the process of fair trade certification. This year this producer is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy the inputs needed for his coffee plantation, in order to get a good harvest this cycle. For the next years, he is set on improving the conditions of his farm and with this the earnings so that he can give a better level of life to his family. He is sure that the investment in his coffee plantation will improve his financial conditions.

loans.use: To buy the inputs needed for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old widow. She has one child of her own, age 11 years, and supports two of her sister's children of 14 and 8 years.

Mary sells fruits and vegetables, a business she has done for the last two years, earning a profit of KES 5,000. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the KES 10,000 to purchase additional stock of vegetables and fruits. With the profits earned, Mary will be able to purchase food for her family as well as repay her loan.

Her desire is to see her child as well as her sister's children educated for life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more tools for farming.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 25 years old.  He sells andazi (doughnuts) and has been in this business for the past five years. 

With the loan requested by Jean Claude, he will be buying more baking powder and flour to make andazi to sell. 

He plans to use the profits for savings.

loans.use: To buy more baking powder and flour to make andazi (doughnuts) to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods, such as water, to sell.

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: Xiomara se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora que ha sabido manejar su capital, se dedica al Comercio de Ropa de Damas, Caballeros y niños; así también vende cosméticos, Zapatos entre otros artículos negocio que administra desde hace mas de 10 años aplicándolo para el mantenimiento de su hogar, ha sacado adelante a sus tres hijos quienes trabajan y estudian en la Universidad.  Xiomara a pesar de ser madre soltera se esfuerza en su trabajo día a día se levanta con la esperanza que cada vez lleguen sus clientes y pueda garantizar el sustento diario con la ganancia. Tiene la necesidad de invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita crédito para comprar Ropa variada, Calzado para incrementar su inventario y así obtener mayores ganancias ya que el gastos cada vez es mayor por las obligaciones en su hogar y el incremento en la canasta básica, por lo que necesita solucionar con créditos y no afectar su capital de trabajo. Ha trabajado con créditos y expresa que es la manera de poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Xiomara is known for being a hardworking woman who has been able to manage her capital.  She makes a living selling clothing for men, women, and children.  She also sells cosmetics, shoes, and other items.  She has run this business for more than 10 years, using it to support her household.

She has gotten her three children ahead; they work and attend college.  In spite of being a single mother, Xiomara works hard in her job.  Every day she rises with the hope that every time her customers arrive, the profit will guarantee her daily sustenance.

She needs to invest in her business, so she's requesting a loan to buy a variety of clothing and footwear to increase her inventory and earn more profit.

Her expenses are more all the time because of her household obligations and the increase in the cost of staples, which she needs to address with loans so as not to affect her working capital.  She has had loans and said it's the way to be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 34-year-old hardworking man who supports a family of three children, age 12, 6 and 4 years old. Lucy, his spouse, adds an additional income to provide to their family's welfare. 

Joshua has been operating a motorcycle business by providing transport facilities to his clients for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

Joshua is now servicing his second loan of KES 22,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and he intends to add it to his savings to buy another motorcycle to boost his business.

Joshua plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and further their education to higher levels. He hopes to have growth in his business and live a stable life.

loans.use: To add to his savings to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betty es una joven que vive en una pequeña comunidad del norte de Nicaragua, es madre de un pequeño de 4 meses. Desde los 20 años se dedica a la caficultura, y desde la llegada de su hijo lucha por darle todo lo que necesita. 

En su pequeña parcela de 1.4 Hectáreas de café, ha logrado una producción de 28 quintales de café oro por hectárea. Su emprendedurismo le ha permitido ir mejorando los rendimientos y calidad de su cafetal, y para este ciclo además de gestionar recursos para las actividades de mantenimiento, también está solicitando un crédito que le permita construir un beneficio húmedo para tener mejores resultados en cuanto a calidad y rendimiento.

Su sueño es ir mejorando las condiciones de su parcela y continuar invirtiendo en este rubro, el cual dice que tiene un gran potencial económico para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Betty is a young woman who lives in a small community in the north of Nicaragua. She is the mother of a small 4-month-old child. For 20 years she has worked growing coffee, and since the arrival of her child, she has struggled to give him everything that he needs.

In her small parcel of 1.4 hectares of coffee, she has been able to produce 28 quintals of golden bean coffee per hectare. Her entrepreneurship has allowed her to improve the yields and quality of her coffee crops, and for this cycle, as well as managing resources for maintaining the crops, she is also asking for a loan that allows her to construct a wet mill to have better results in quality and output.

Her dream is to improve the conditions of her parcel and to continue investing in this work, which she says has a great economic potential to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a wet mill to have better results.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 25 year-old, married woman from the village of Tsinsvla. She lives with her husband and 2 little sons. 

There is high unemployment rate in the region so small businesses are more predominant.  Nana and her husband are also involved someone's private business.  In particular, they generate income from working at a bakery as a baker and sales associate.  

As a rule, part of their salaries are shared with the bakery's owner. So, they generate an income that isn't enough for a family of four and they live in poverty. Nana has a great desire to start her own business and open a bakery at a good location. 

They are an experienced couple and it will be easy for them to run the business. She has requested 1200 USD for purchasing all the needed equiptment and was approved for the start-up program, which helps people to start or re-start businesses. Consequently, this hard-working couple will be able to generate more income and run the business themselves.

Nana and her family rely on the goodwill of lenders and highly appreciate it.

loans.use: to open traditional a Georgian bakery

loans.name: Yehia

texts.en:
Yehya is a 24-year-old single man and the sole earner of four members of his family.  Yehya had to quit school at the elementary level in order to help to provide his family with the necessary income for their living.  With 12 years of hard work in repairing trucks body work, he has acquired a good experience and reputation in his domain and is well respected for his honesty. 

Yehya is an ambitious man who does anything it takes to provide for his family.  He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy new furniture for his family's house. As a previous borrower with Al Majmoua, Yehya was able to greatly improve the living condition of his family. 

In the future, he dreams of establishing his own business so he can have a better income.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for his family's house

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 25-year-old, single man. He quit school at the intermediate level and just recently started his own motorcycle repair business just a few months ago, which provides him with a modest income. 

Hussein is an ambitious man who pursues every opportunity in life.  He acquired a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase motorcycles to sell since they are in high demand by residents in the surrounding area.  

He hopes to develop his business later which would provide him more long-term sustainability.

loans.use: To  purchase motorcycles to resell

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.en:
Marie Jeanne is 49 years old. She is married with nine children.

 She owns a dairy and she has spent more than twenty years in this business. With the loan, she would like to buy extra fresh dairy for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more fresh dairy to sell.

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado tiene 68 años de edad, es un caficultor del norte del país, es un padre y esposo comprometido con su familia. Posee una pequeña finca con 2.81 hectáreas de café cultivado, la cual ha trabajado en los últimos 15 años. 

En el ciclo anterior, su producción se vio comprometida hasta el 50%; por lo que este año ha decidido implementar un plan de mantenimiento que le ayude a mejorar la condición nutricional de sus cafetos, para lo cual está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas, y lograr así una mejor cosecha y mayores ingresos para su familia.

Para este productor, la mayor herencia que puede dejar a sus hijos, es el amor al trabajo y a la caficultura, el cual ha sido un cultivo al que su familia por diferentes generaciones se ha dedicado, y que él ahora maneja bajo criterios de certificación como comercio justo.
texts.en:
Amado, age 68, is a coffee farmer in the northern part of the country.  He is a father and husband that is committed to his family.  He has a small farm of 2.81 hectares of cultivated coffee.  He has worked it for the past 15 years.

In the previous cycle his production was up to 50% compromised.  Therefore, this year he has decided to implement a maintenance plan that will help him improve the nutritional condition of his coffee plants.  In order to do this, he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies.  This way he will manage to get a better harvest and greater income for his family.

To this producer the greatest legacy he is able to leave his children is the love of work and coffee farming.  For generations his family has devoted itself to coffee farming.  He now works under the certification criteria of Fair Trade.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 37-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Rukhsana requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. 

She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Ameeran

texts.en:
Ameeran, is a 52-year-old married woman. She has three children and wishes to provide them with a better standard of living.  Her husband’s income is not sufficient to bear household expenses alone. That is why Ameeran started a business selling animals in her locality. She earns good amount of income to contribute in the family income.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase two more animals. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good repayment history.  

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more animals.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Andres Abelino

texts.es:
Andrés es un pequeño caficultor del norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con 1.05 hectárea de café en una zona rural alejada del casco urbano, la cual atiende junto a su esposa. Antes trabajaba como obrero en diferentes fincas, logrando adquirir su pequeña parcela la cual maneja desde hace 8 años. 

Con la afectación de la roya sus cafetos se vieron afectados, por lo que para mejorar la condición de su plantación, este año está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de los insumos que requiere su cafetal y mejorar la nutrición de sus plantas para alcanzar una buena cosecha y con ello mayores ingresos para continuar mejorando las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés is a small coffee farmer from the north of Nicaragua. He has 1.05 hectares of coffee in a rural zone far from the urban center, which he looks after with his wife. Before, he worked as a laborer in different farms, allowing him to acquire his small parcel, which he has worked for 8 years.

His coffee trees have been affected by the effects of the blight, because of which to improve the condition of his field, this year he is requesting financing. He will use it to purchase the supplies that his coffee crops require to improve his plants’ nutrition to achieve a good harvest, and with it a better income to continue improving his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies that his coffee crops require and to improve his plants' nutrition.

loans.name: Candida Roza Laguna Pozo

texts.es:
Cándida es una joven de 24 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 3 años. Esta mujer emprendedora posee 2.81 hectáreas de café, la cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

En el ciclo pasado, Cándida estuvo atenta para controlar el riesgo de la enfermedad de la roya que afectó varias plantaciones de café de su zona. Logró que los efectos no fueran mayores, sin embargo su producción disminuyó, por lo que para este ciclo ella está solicitando un préstamo para adquirir los insumos que requiere su cafetal para un buen mantenimiento, y asegurar una buena cosecha.

Ella sueña con dejar un patrimonio a sus hijos, un medio con que el que puedan mejorar sus ingresos económicos  y tener mejores condiciones y oportunidades que las que ella ha tenido, y está segura que la caficultura es una actividad económica rentable, con lo cual puede alcanzar su sueño
texts.en:
Cándida is a 24-year old woman who has a 3-year old son. She is an entrepreneur and owns 2.81 hectares of coffee plantation, which she runs following fair trade standards. 

During the past cycle, Cándida was very alert to control the risk of "roya", which affected several coffee plantations in the area. She was able to limit the consequences, but her production decreased. She is requesting a loan this cycle so that she can buy the necessary supplies for a good maintenance and guarantee of a good crop. 

Her dream is to leave assets to her children, so that they can enjoy better financial means, life conditions and opportunities than her. She believes cultivating coffee in a profitable activity and that it will let her achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy the necessary supplies for a good maintenance of her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 64-year-old married woman with ten children. She lives in rural setting with her husband and four grandchildren. She is a businesswoman who deals in charcoal and wholesaling beer. She works six days a week and each day she works for 16 hours. She supplements her family income with agriculture, which she carries out seasonally. Margret has been in charcoal trading for 20 years. She started in that business to give support to her husband in matters of school fees. 

Margret applied for her second Kiva loan in order to restock her business and to be able to serve her clients well. She sells her products to residents near her home and her greatest dream is to build and own rental properties. Margret describes herself as an honest and hard-working lady.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and beer to sell

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en: Nargis is a married woman. She has been selling milk for the past ten years. She has two cows who produce milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with the butter that she makes from the milk. Her business works on power looms and is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has four children and all go to school. She is very motivated to provide a beautiful life to her children with a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses in life. This is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She expects a boost in her sales and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan es un pequeño cafetalero de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Por mucho tiempo trabajo como jornalero en varias fincas, pero desde hace 7 años cuenta con su pequeña parcela de café la cual maneja bajo procesos de certificación como comercio justo.

Con el apoyo técnico de la asociación a la cual está afiliado, ha creado un plan de manejo nutricional para su cafetal, por lo que requiere el financiamiento para comprar los insumos agrícolas que le permitan tener una buena producción este año, y con ello mejorar económicamente las condiciones de su familia.

Su meta es continuar mejorando su pequeña finca y ampliando sus áreas de café, para seguir creciendo y generando oportunidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan works cultivating coffee in the north side of Nicaragua. He worked as a day laborer for a long time, but 7 years ago he started to run his own small field under fair trade standards. 

Thanks to the technical support of the association where he belongs, he has created a nutritional plan for his coffee plantation. He needs financial support to buy the farming supplies that would lead to a good crop this year and improve the life conditions of his family. His goal is to keep making improvements to his field and expanding the plantation area, so that the business can grow and generate opportunities for his family.

loans.use: to buy the farming supplies that will lead to a good crop.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: At the age of forty-one, Hanifa is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has been in the business of selling goats for about five years. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is supporting her family of seven with the help of her husband. She is running a successful business to lead them to a decent life. She buys baby goats at low prices, brings them up and then sells them at a higher price to the people of her community. She has improved her business by taking loans from Kashf Foundation and currently she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all the hard work she puts into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is 54 years old and a vigorous lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. At this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stocks of rice, sugar, oil and flour. This will allow her to meet the increasing demands of her customers and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Nasrin

texts.en:
Nasrin is a 42-year-old lady. She enjoys doing  hand embroidery. For about 13 years she has been doing hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old married woman doing business selling milk for the past 5 years. She has 2 calves and 2 cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She has two children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

Irshad has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with support of it. Irshad has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She expects a boost in her sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Atta  Elahe

texts.en: Atta Elahe is a 45-year-old married woman and has been running a business selling milk with her husband for about 20 years. She has two buffaloes in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. She is a mother of two children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and health. In order to make huge profits, Atta Elahe requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 42-year-old married woman. For the past 12 years, she has been successfully running a business selling milk. She sells milk to the people of her community. Over time, Farzana has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Farzana’s husband is employed as laborer but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Farzana is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of one. She has been running a business selling ready-to-wear clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She is a well-known seller in her town.

 At present, Parveen requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a variety of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 44-year-old married woman and a dedicated mother of four children. One of her sons runs a donkey cart as a means of transportation for carrying things. Three years ago, he started this business with a single donkey cart and carried materials from one place to another. He earns enough profit from this business.

 In order to purchase a bigger-sized wooden cart to have more capacity, Azra contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. In this way her son would be able to carry more items like fruits and vegetables, etc. at the same time. Azra is thankful to Kashf for its support. She desires to utilize part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a big-sized wooden cart.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 29-year-old married lady. Currently her spouse doesn't provide additional income. Together with her spouse, they are blessed with three children of 12, 8 and 6 years, respectively.

Susan sells food and makes a monthly income of 9,700 KES. She has requested a loan of 5,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase supplies of cereals, flour and vegetables to prepare and sell in her hotel. With the profits from the business, Susan will be able to pay her children's school fees. This is her first loan term and she looks forward to educating her children for life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of cereals, flour and vegetables

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
At the age of 45, Sajida is a married woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Allah  Rakhi

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi is 52 years old, a married woman, running a business of cattle trade with her son for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 3rd  loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jose Ariel

texts.es:
José es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, cuenta con 1.41 hectárea de café la cual ha venido trabajando con esfuerzo y dedicación.  Antes trabajó como obrero en otras fincas de la zona, por lo que siempre ha estado relacionado a la caficultura.

Para este año, él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de los insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal a fin de mejorar la nutrición de las plantas y con ello la producción y calidad de su café en este ciclo.

Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su familia y está seguro que invirtiendo en este rubro puede llegar a conseguirlo.
texts.en:
José is a small coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. He has 1.41 hectares of coffee which he has been working with effort and dedication. Before this he worked as labor on other farms in the area, so he has always been involved with coffee growing.

For this season José is requesting a loan to buy inputs and fertilizer that his coffee crops need in order to improve the plant's nutrition. That would also improve the quality and production of his coffee in this cycle. His dream is to improve his family's living conditions and he is certain that investing in this way he will be able to achieve that.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizer as required for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Nadra

texts.en:
Nadra has successfully built her business, a beauty parlor, with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family. 

Now, in her 6th loan cycle, Nadra has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase packs of makeup kits, lipsticks and whitening creams and lotions. It will allow her to cater to more customers to generate a greater source of income.

loans.use: to purchase packs of makeup kits, lipsticks and whitening creams and lotions.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José lleva 30 años dedicándose a la caficultura, y aunque es un trabajo de esfuerzo y consistencia, confía en que es el mejor patrimonio que puede dejar a sus hijos para mejorar las condiciones económicas en que se encuentran. Cuenta con 2.11 hectáreas de café que maneja en conjunto con su esposa e hijo. Además, posee en su finca otros rubros como maíz y frijoles.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para comprar los insumos agrícolas que requiere su cafetal y lograr una buena producción este año. Su sueño es tener una finca de mayor extensión territorial, y para ello dice que debe invertir en los recursos que posee para generar mayores ingresos y poder alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
José has dedicated his past 30 years to growing coffee. Although it is work that requires effort and consistency he is confident that the best inheritance he can leave his children is to improve the economic situation they are in. He has 2.11 hectares of coffee that he manages together with his wife and child. Besides that they also have other crops on their farm like corn and beans.

For this cycle he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs that are required for his coffee crops in order to achieve high production this year. His dream is to own a larger farm in size and to do this he says he must invest in the resources he has. Then he can generate more income and he can reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs as required for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has seven years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Rubina is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with high quality food, clothing and health. 

Rubina wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy packs of salt, sugar, oil, tea, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, sugar, oil, tea, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 41 years old, married, and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested for a loan of 35,000 PKR which she will use to buy supplies of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Khalida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy supplies of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a self-employed woman from the village of Nalbandyan in the Armavir region. She lives with her husband, son and daughter-in-law. Another son of Lida's has moved to the Russian Federation to earn money and suppport his family financially. 

Jointly with her family members, Lida has been engaged in agriculture for many years. In particular, they own an orchard in the village and cultivate various types of fruits and vegetables there. In addition, they are engaged in animal husbandry. 

Lida has taken several loans in order to finance various agricultural activities and has a very good credit history with no delinquent payments. The family's agribusiness needs some investments to function more efficiently. This is why Lida has applied for a loan of USD 3000. It will enable her to purchase animal feed and buy 20 bags of fertilizers. 

Lida and her family are grateful to all the lenders for their goodwill in helping them collect the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed and fertilizers (20 bags)

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida has successfully built her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva.At this time she a good number of customers and makes a good income to contribute in the family. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to sew more dresses on time to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a 29 year-old married man who has been blessed with one child.  His wife adds additional income to their family.  

Titus operates a pharmacy,  which has been in operation for two years,earning him an income of KES.5,000 monthly.

Titus is now asking for his second loan of KES. 10,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to add more medications to boost his business with a greater variety medicine in order to meet his client's needs.  

Titus plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children and expand the current business by introducing a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more bulk stock of medications for his pharmacy

loans.name: Carmela Del Socorro

texts.es:
Carmela es una mujer emprendedora que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Junto con su esposo y dos de sus hijos se dedica a la producción de café, el cual maneja bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo.

Además del café, también se dedica al acopio y comercialización de frijoles y maíz en su comunidad, esto como parte de la búsqueda de recursos para garantizar las necesidades de su familia.

El ciclo pasado su finca se vio afectada por la enfermedad de la roya, lo que hizo que sus niveles de cosecha disminuyeran hasta en un 50%, por lo que para este nuevo ciclo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan implementar el plan de mantenimiento que requiere su cafetal, a fin de mejorar los rendimientos y calidad de su cosecha.
texts.en:
