Carmela is an enterprising woman who lives in a rural community in the north of Nicaragua. Together with her husband and two of her children she works producing coffee following the criteria required for Free Trade coffee.

Besides growing coffee she also works storing and selling beans and corn in her community. This is part of a search for resources to guarantee the necessities for her family.

In the previous growing season her crops were affected by coffee rust which reduced her production by about 50 %. So for this new season she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and manure which will permit her to implement a maintenance plan that her plantation needs in order to improve her production and the quality of her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin tiene 61 años de edad, es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 16.02 hectáreas de las cuales 1.4 son de café. Tiene 40 años dedicándose a la siembra y cosecha de café y actualmente, cuenta con tres certificaciones que le han ayudado a mejorar el precio de comercialización de su producto. Además del café, se dedica al acopio y comercialización de granos básicos. 

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permitan mejorar los rendimientos y calidad de su café, y con ello incrementar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Martin is 61 years old and is a coffee producer in the northern region of Nicaragua. His farm is 16.02 hectares and 1.4 hectares of those are coffee. He has been growing coffee for 40 years and currently he has three certifications which help him raise the selling price for his product. Besides coffee he works in storing and selling basic grains. For this season he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and manure which will allow him to increase his production and the quality of his coffee. And doing this he will increase the income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure which will improve his production.

loans.name: Sania

texts.en:
Sania is a 24-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for a number of years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also sells animals seasonally to generate an extra amount of income.  

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her milk sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Evelyn Ninoska

texts.es:
La señora Evelyn Ninoska, es madre soltera de 3 pequeños hijos de los cuales están bajo su tutela y se encuentra en edad escolar, labora como operaria en unas de las empresas privadas de la ciudad de León, se dedica a esta desde hace 2 años, inicia sus labores en turnos variados de 06:00 am y finalizándolas a las 02:00 pm y e 02:00 pm a 10:00 pm de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario, el realiza esta labor para la mantención de sus pequeños hijos y de su hogar.

Doña Evelyn,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  para la compra de láminas de zinc, las cuales serán implementadas en la remodelación y mejora del techo de su humilde vivienda ya que estamos en el período de invierno permitiéndole brindarles a sus pequeños hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Evelyn Ninoska is a single mother of 3 young children who attend school and are under her responsibility. She has bee a worker in one of the private companies of the city of León for 2 years. She works in shifts from 6am to 2pm and 2pm to 10pm, Monday through Saturday. Thanks to this job she can support her children and cover household expenses. 

Evelyn requested a loan to Ceprodel to buy zinc layers. She will use them to repair and improve the ceiling of her modest house now that they are in winter season. This will allow her to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy zinc layers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Lady Fabiola

texts.es:
Lady tiene 27 años de edad, estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 3  años de edad en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Lady se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganado y cerdos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ganado. Las compras realizan en el mercado de Las Guardias. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre se dedica al hogar.
texts.en:
Lady is a 27-year old single woman who lives with her parents and 2 children, ages 5 and 3, in the community of Pailaloma, in Cantón San Miguel (province of Bolívar). She is a member of the Patrón San Miguel group and lives in the community of Pailaloma, 40 minutes away from the cooperative. She works in agriculture and breeding of cattle and pigs. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cattle in Las Guardias market. Her goal is to improve the sale of her animals and her biggest challenge is transportation. She is in charge of household chores in her free time.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Karim-Batloun Group

texts.en:
Loubna is the featured representative of the Karim-Batloun Group. She and her other group members are best friends who got together to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to improve their families' living standards.

Loubna is a 32-year-old, married mother of two. She is a Syrian citizen who works hard to support her beloved husband in their living. Two years ago, she established her own home business, selling clothes, so that she could help support her husband in covering their family's increasing expenses. 

The biggest challenge Loubna has faced to date has been acquiring enough funding to start her business. Her business is now progressing just fine. 

Loubna has always dreamed of expanding her business, so she acquired a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to buy new clothes for the summer season, which happens to be Loubna's busiest time of the year.  

Loubna's motivation drives her to, one day, open her own shop, where she can better display her clothes and service her customer's needs. 

Loubna is wearing the yellow top in the photo, while Basima is the hairdresser wearing black, and Mahmouda is sitting in front of her.

loans.use: to buy and sell new clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Mouyoussi Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de sept femmes, les membres du groupe Mouyoussi sont uniquement mariées et vie dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne  d’âge 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati. Elles se sont connues à travers des tontines dans le quartier et leurs activités génératrices de revenu.Les membres du groupe mènent des activités génératrices de revenu  différent, notamment la vente d’habits, d’encens, du charbon de bois, du bois de chauffage et de cocos.Dans  le souci d’élargir et d’agrandir  leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso  il ya 1 mois et sont à leur premier  prêt  en solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une bonne notoriété dans la vente des habits au marché de Kanadjiguila. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20pièces de pagnes wax. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché. Elle mène ses activités au comptant à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Fatoumata compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 FCFA par mois, qui sera utilisé, pour satisfaire son besoin et investir le reste dans son activité. Madame a pour objectif de fidéliser  ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’en profiter beaucoup de prêt.
texts.en:
The Mouyoussi Group is made up of seven married women who live in monogamous households. The average age of the group's members is 33 years old
and each member has an average of four children each. They all live in the Kanadjiguila district of Mandé, in Kati Cercle. They know each other through the local savings groups and through their money-generating activities. The members of the group each carry out different revenue-generating activities, notably the retail of clothing, incense, wood charcoal, firewood and coconuts. In order to expand and grow their businesses, they decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso one month ago in order to request their first loan.

Fatoumata (the woman sat to the far right of the photo) has a good reputation for selling clothing at the market in Kanadjiguila. She plans on using this loan to purchase 20 sheets of pagne wax cloth. She gets her supplies from the main market. She sells her goods in Kanadjiguila in exchange for cash to a female-majority customer base. With this loan, Fatoumata plans on making an average profit of 35,000 FCFA per month. This will be used to pay for her necessities, with whatever is left being reinvested into her business. Her goal is to establish a strong partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to make the most of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 30 years old. She is married to James and together they support their family. Elizabeth requested a loan of Kshs. 18,000 which she used to purchase timber and nails for her carpentry business.

With the profits from the business, Elizabeth will be able to  pay school fees for her children as well as purchase a cow.

This is her second loan after successfully repaying her previous loan.

Elizabeth dreams of buying her family a plot of land. She also desires to see her children educated for life.

loans.use: to purchase timber and nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her herd and expand her business

loans.name: Yusifa

texts.en:
Yusifa is a 46-year-old farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Yusifa, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Yusifa can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yusifa is ambitious and is aiming to reap 150 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Yusifa said, “I plan to use the money I make to build a better home,” and in 5 years, I want to “ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double his income and yield

loans.name: Isah

texts.en:
Isah is a 67-year-old farmer from Gwanki. As a Babban Gona member, Isah, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isah can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Isah is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season because this loan will give him the opportunity to purchase high yielding inputs such as improved seeds. 

When asked how he plans to spend his anticipated income at the end of the season, Isah said, “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Abdulazeez, Ahimu, and  Sabi'u, and ultimately, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double his yield and income

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en:
This Kamu Kamu sub-group is located in a rural area and has 4 members.  Their names are Fred, Peter, Jesca and Daniel. They are involved in different businesses which include retail shops, bars, selling coffee, matooke trading, farming and raising animals.

Fred is a 30-year-old married man with three children, two attend school. He takes care of three orphans. He is a farmer and also trades produce as a side business, which he started in 2002. He works seven days a week and up to 16 hours per day to improve his family’s standard of living. 

Fred acquired this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farm. The major challenges he faces are lack of capital and occasional drought. His hope for the future is to buy a plot of land and build some rentals so that he can further expand and diversify his income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Mariela De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La joven Mariela de los Ángeles,  labora como analista de etiquetas en unas de las empresas privadas de la ciudad de León, se dedica a esta desde hace 3 año, inicia sus labores en turnos variados de 06:00 am y finalizándolas a las 02:00 pm y e 02:00 pm a 10:00 pm de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario, el realiza esta labor para la mantención de su hogar.

La joven Mariela,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  para gastos médicos como es la compra de medicamento, lo cual le permitirá recuperar la salud lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Mariela de los Ángeles works as a labeling analyst in a private firm in the city of Leon. She has been doing this for 3 years. She starts her work at 6 am and finishes at 2 pm or does a 2 pm to 10 pm shift from Monday to Saturday. She does this work to support her household.

Mariela has come to Ceprodel to request a loan which she will use for medical expenses such as buying medicine, which will permit her to recover her health as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза уроженка города Душанбе. Ей 21 год. Она живет вместе с родителями, двумя братьями и сестрой. Фируза учиться в Университете языков. После окончания Университета она надеется поступить на магистратуру и продолжить учебу. На данный момент Фируза занимается кройкой и шитьем женской одежды. Она берет заказы на дому. Фируза старательная девушка и все время старается обучиться к чему-то новому. 
   Швейная машинка Фирузы устарела, не выполняет работу качественно как прежде, чтобы купить новую современную швейную машинку ей необходимо $1000. Она надеется получить кредит и потратить денежные средства целенаправленно.
texts.en:
Firuza is a native of the city of Dushanbe. She is 21. She lives with her parents, two brothers, and a sister. Firuza studies at the University of Languages. After graduation, she hopes to enroll in a master's degree program and continue her studies. Firuza currently works cutting and sewing women's clothes. She takes orders from home. Firuza is a diligent girl who is constantly trying to learn something new. 

Firuza's sewing machine is outdated and does not create quality work. To buy a new modern sewing machine, she needs $1,000. She hopes to get a loan and spend money wisely.

loans.use: buy a new modern sewing machine

loans.name: Nayfi

texts.en:
Nayfi is a 49-year-old widowed mother of three, who has worked in agriculture for fifteen years to support her beloved family after her beloved husband passed away. 

In 2004, she established her own planting business, and since that time she has worked hard to develop it as much as she can to make sure it will provide her family with a good income. 

Today Nayfi requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her plantation and buy necessary seed.  She wants to maintain her land and make it productive.

She hopes that she can diversify her products and provide a wide variety of plants to her customers.

loans.use: to increase her plantation and buy necessary seed, to maintain her land.

loans.name: Marhamatkhon

texts.ru: Мархаматхон добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и живет вместе со своей семьей на Севере Таджикистана. Она заботливая мать 3 детей. Мархаматхон упорно трудится для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги для обеспечения семьи. Она портниха. Мархаматхон более 10 лет занимается предоставлением услуги портнихи. Она шьёт национальные и европейские стили одежды. Мархаматхон также вышивает вышивки с национальными узорами. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 10 лет. Мархаматхон имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Мархаматхон планирует купить вышивальную машинку для увеличения оборотного капитала.  Мархаматхон запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Marhamatkhon is a conscientious and hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her family northern Tajikistan. She is the caring mother of three children. Marhamatkhon works hard to earn money for the family. She is a dressmaker. Marhamatkhon has been working as a dressmaker for more than ten years. She sews traditional and European clothing. Marhamatkhon also embroiders traditional patterns. She has been doing this business for more than ten years. Marhamatkhon has loyal customers. Marhamatkhon plans to buy an embroidery machine to increase her  working capital. Marhamatkhon is requesting a loan of 2000 KGS. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: buy an embroidery machine to increase her working capital

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline is a 41-year-old married woman who has five children. Her husband adds additional income to support the welfare of the family.  Karoline has operated a grocery and farming business for fourteen years to earn an income of 4,000 KES.

Karoline requests a second loan with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to increase her produce and to build a permanent grocery stall.  

Karoline plans to use the anticipated income to expand her current business and educate her children.  It is her hope and desire that  she will buy another piece of land to increase production and expand her grocery business.

loans.use: to build a permanent grocery stall.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla is a 46-year-old widowed mother of four children.  She has run a call center sicne 2006 to support her children's living after her beloved husband passed away leaving her responsible for their living.

Nahla provides several services in one location. She also sells women accessories, mobile phones, and makeup.

Today, Nahla requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business  with special women's merchandise and mobile phone accessories.

She hopes to expand and increase her business capital to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phones accessories.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Millicent has been running a spare part retail shop and earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for a loan of KES.30,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy more stock of spare  parts for sale.She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

Millicent will grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spare  parts for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add more stock to her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods such as peppers, oil, butter, bitter ball (squash), etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pepper, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Nema Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nema est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 37ans et 2enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, tubercules (patates), fruits et habits.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Baïné (femme debout en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des poissons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de patate sen gros à Médine.La vente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila  et à une clientèle mixte. Madame Baïné espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’ouvrir un restaurant.
texts.en:
The Nema group is composed solely of women living in monogamous families. On the average, they are 37 years old, with two children. They all live in Kanadjiguila,  n the township of Mandé, district of Kati, and know each other as neighbors. The group members work as vendors sell tubers (potatoes), fruits, clothing etc. With the goal of increasing their work capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan.

Mrs. Bainé (the second one standing from left to right in the photo) is well-known as a fish vendor. She plans to use her loan to buy three bags of potatoes wholesale in Medine. She sells retail in Kanadjiguila, to a mixed clientele. Mrs. Bainé hopes to earn an average monthly benefit of 30,000 West African francs which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to open a diner.

loans.use: to buy tubers (

loans.name: On Time Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a mother of one child who is still young. She is married and has been supporting her family by running a charcoal store.  She has been in her business since 2011. She works from 7:00am to 6.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal. She dreams of owning a Bajaji (Tricycle).

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group, On Time Group, with a total of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Angin

texts.en:
Angin is a farmer from the village of Shaki in the Syunik region. She lives there with her husband, her son and her daughter. Together with her family members, Angin has been engaged in agribusiness for already 10 years. They raise cows and hens and cultivate potatoes, corn, and various types of fruit. The family sells the agricultural products in the local market. 

With a very good credit history, Angin and her family members now want to expand their agribusiness and increase their revenue. A loan of 3,000 will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family and will enable her to purchase 3 heifers, 100 sheeps, 500 litres of fuel and 18 bags of fertilizer. 
Angin and her family members rely on the good will of the lenders and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock (3 heifers and 10 sheeps), fuel (500 litres), and fertilizer (18 bags)

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Teriya est  majoritairement composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent à Kanadjiguila commune du Mandé / cercle de Kati et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax) de toutes les qualités, et de restauration.Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Koniba(femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax de toutes les qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 50 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché.La revente se fait en détails à Kanadjiguila et à une clientèle mixte. Madame Koniba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’augmenter ses revenus dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Teriya  Group is mostly made up of monogamous women. The average age of the group's members is 35 years old and each member has an average of four children each. They live in the Kanadjiguila district of Mandé, in Kati Cercle and they know each other through the bonds of community. The members of the group work in the retail of clothing made from pagne wax cloth of various qualities and they also run restaurants. In order to expand their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their second loan.

Koniba (the woman standing to the far right of the photo) has a good reputation for selling all kinds of pagne wax-cloth clothing. She plans on using this loan to purchase 50 sheets of pagne wax cloth in bulk from the main market. She sells her goods in Kanadjiguila to a mixed customer base. With this loan, Koniba plans on making an average profit of 80,000 FCFA per month. This money will be reinvested into her business in order to grow her revenue in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to purchase clothing made from pagne wax cloth

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Ее зовут Хайринисо. Она уроженка города Душанбе. Ей 45 лет. Хайринисо замужем за таксиста. У них в браке имеется двое детей. Старшему сыну 25 лет, младшему 12 лет. Хайринисо работает дома. Она портниха, принимает заказы на подшив и на шитье женской одежды . Она любит свою работу и намерена далее продолжить расти в этом направлении. Хайринисо научилась шить у своей мамы, которая свое время было отличной рукодельницей. У Хайринисо возникли финансовые затруднение, и она решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить швейные принадлежности.  Поддержите Хайринисо, она надеется на Вас.
texts.en: This woman's name is Khayriniso. She is 45 and a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is married to a taxi driver and they have two sons aged 25 and 12. Khayriniso works at home as a dressmaker, taking orders for tailoring and sewing women's clothing. She learned the trade from her mother, who was an excellent seamstress in her time. She loves her work and wants to continue developing the business, but she has come into some financial difficulties and needs a loan to purchase sewing equipment. Please support Khayriniso - she is resting her hopes on you.

loans.use: to purchase sewing equipment

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia  is 57 years old and supports three children who are 18, 14, and 10 years old. Her husband is a farmer and helps to support the family.

Sofia has requested a loan of Kshs. 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya to help her purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

This is her first loan and she hopes to pay school fees for her children as well as expand her business further with the profits.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric and increasing working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, table, and an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Sham'igul

texts.ru: Шамъигул в возрасте 45 лет собирается начать собственный торговый бизнес. Она родом из приграничного района Джиликуль. Шамъигул живет там со своими двумя взрослыми сыновьями. Она вырастила их без мужа. В данный момент Шамъигул на собственное сбережение рядом с домом построила двухэтажное помещение под магазин. Она собирается продавать там разный ассортимент товаров, в частности парфюмерию, косметику, детские игрушки, сувениры, ковры и т.д. Однако для приобретения данного товара, ей не хватает денежных средств. В связи с этим Шаъмигул обратилась за кредитом. На часть суммы кредита она собирается купить товар, а на остальную часть приобрести необходимые принадлежности для своего  нового магазина. Благодаря кредиту она начнет свою новую деятельность и обеспечит себя и своих сыновей работой.
texts.en: Sham’igul is 45 years old and plans to launch her own sales business. She was born in the border region of Jilikul. She still lives there with her two grown sons. She has raised her sons on her own, without a husband. At present Sham’igul has used her savings to build a two-floor store next to her house. She plans to sell miscellaneous items such as perfume, cosmetics, children’s toys, souvenirs, rugs etc. However, she lacks the necessary funds to stock merchandise. This is why Sham’igul has applied for a loan. She plans to use part of her loan to buy merchandise, and the rest to buy the necessary equipment for her new store. Thanks to this loan she will launch a new business and have work for herself and her sons.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise (perfume, cosmetics, children’s toys, souvenirs, rugs etc.) and buy equipment for her store.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 27-year-old married woman and has been blessed with one child. Her husband earns additional income to provide for their family. Edith has been operating a clothing sales business for a period of four years earning an income of KES 10,000.

Edith is now servicing her third loan of KES 60,000 with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to add more stock of second-hand clothes and to open a stall to boost her business so that she may satisfy her clients' expectations. 

She plans to use the anticipated income to educate her child and to open more clothing stalls in the neighboring towns. She hopes to have growth in her business and live a stable life.

loans.use: To open a clothing stall and add more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and embroidery machine.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en: The Chrito Nti group consists of eight people who live in the same neighborhood. They earn a living by selling second-hand clothing, pastries, foodstuffs, materials, linen, yam, and fish. The group leader is Lydia, age 58, who is single and all of whose children are grown up. She received secondary-level schooling, and has earned a living for the last seven years by selling second-hand clothing. She has been very successful and is passionate about this work because it allows her to support herself. She buys her supplies in Accra, Ghana. To increase her working capital and maintain customer satisfaction, Lydia and the other members of her group are seeking a loan from ID-Ghana. This will help them better meet customer demand and bolster their profits.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, an embroidery machine, and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, iron and fabrics.

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush is a self-employed person from Sverdlov village of Lori region. She lives there with her husband, her son, and two daughters. Jointly with her family members, Vardanush has been engaged in animal husbandry for a long time. Particularly, they are specialized in cattle and pig breeding. They sell their agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of this family's income. 

To sustain her agricultural business and make it more profitable, Vardanush needs a loan of USD 3000. This amount will be used to buy two cows and repair their machinery. Let's help this hard-working woman and her family succeed as they really need support to expand their agricultural business. They will be extremely grateful to all the lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock (two cows) and repair agricultural machinery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, a sewing machine and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mannequins, a table and generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar and tea leaves and to buy exercise books and uniforms

loans.name: Ndama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 octobre 2012. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui habitent le même village et ceux des environs. La plupart des femmes font le commerce et l’embouche. Une bonne entente règne entre elles.
Ndeye debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants.
Avec le prêt elle envisage de faire du commerce de poisson et pendant l’hivernage de l’agriculture. Ainsi elle compte acheter 100kg d’arachide à 400f le kg pour semences. Elle va aussi acheter du poisson pour une valeur de 30000f par jour, elle va avoir un bénéfice de 10000f jour. Ce dernier va lui permettre de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This 26-member group belongs to the banc villageois which was created on 22nd October 2012. This banc groups together members who live in the same village and members who live in the surrounding areas. Most of these women work in retail and raising livestock. They all work together harmoniously.

Ndeye, the woman standing to the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 37 years old. She is a married mother to eight children.

With this loan, she is planning on selling fish and peanuts during the winter seasons. She plans on purchasing 100 kg of peants at 400FCFA/kg for the seeds. She will also purchase 30,000 FCFA's worth of fish per day, which will give her a profit of 10,000 FCFA per day. This will allow her to support her husband in providing for their family.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and fish

loans.name: Kakoni Traders Group

texts.en:
Happy, a 33-year-old female, is married, with four children and is a member of Kakoni Traders Group, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

She deals in the salt trade, a business she has been operating for five years. She is also a fishmonger where she gets additional income. 

Happy began the business to get profits and to save for her increasing family needs. Despite weather challenges, Happy is hard-working, with hopes of seeing her children attain education. Happy needs the loan to buy salt to sell.
 
The extra person in the photo is a member of the group who has not taken a loan.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell.

loans.name: Twanzane Traders Group

texts.en: Florence, aged 48 years, is a single female with two children and a member of the Twanzane Traders Group, living in Kasese, Uganda.  Florence sells crude salt and has been in that business for 10 years. She runs a retail shop for additional income. She began the business to meet her family's daily needs. Florence is a hard working woman who dreams of educating her children plus improving their standard of living. She intends to use the loan to buy crude salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es: Jorge es un joven muy alegre, el se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia desde 2 años atrás, comenta Jorge que tambien trabaja a medio tienpo de vendedor en una farmacia , dice que es bueno el negocio de criar ganado ya que asi tiene un ingreso mas para cubrir los gastos de educacion y mantener a su hijo que tiene 6 años, el credito lo  va a invertir en la compra de terneros, Jorge espera seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio para sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very cheerful young man. He has earned his living in farming and ranching for the past two years. He says that he also works part-time as a sales clerk in a pharmacy. He says that his livestock-raising business is good because it provides an additional income to cover the expenses of caring for and educating his son, who is six years old. He will invest the loan in the purchase of calves. 

Jorge hopes to continue working and improving his business in order to to provide for his son.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Union  Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: Jacinta de 33 años de edad es separada con 03 hijos dependientes. Ella es parte del grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” y está formado por 08 socios optimistas y emprendedores. Hace más de 03 años que Jacinta se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. Gracias a su constante dedicación puede educar a sus hijos y salir adelante en su negocio. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de telas, hilos y botones. El grupo “Unión Por El Progreso” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Jacinta es la tercera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Jacinta is 33 years old and is separated with 3 dependent children. She is part of the group "Unión Por El Progreso" (Union for Progress), made up of 8 optimistic and enterprising members. More than 3 years ago Jacinta began making a living making clothing. Thanks to her constant dedication she can educate her children and suceed in her business. The loan that she requested is to buy fabric, thread and buttons. 

The group "Unión Por El Progreso" is grateful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Jacinta is the third from the right.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Jose Samuel

texts.es:
José, requiere de más capital que en esta ocasión lo invertirá en la compra de pedales, cadenas, parches, neumáticos, etc., son repuestos que le ayudaran a mejorar el servicio que brinda en su taller de bicicletas, la fotografía fue tomada en su otro rubro el cual es una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad.
Con ayuda del financiamiento anterior compro insumas para la tienda lo que resulto muy positivo pues atrajo nuevos clientes, mejoro sus ventas, con las ganancias cubre las necesidades de su familia, cancelo su deuda y remodelo el local de su negocio.
texts.en:
José needs more capital that, on this occasion, he will invest in the purchase of pedals, chains, patches, tires, etc. These are spare parts that will help him improve the service that he offers in his bicycle workshop. 

The photograph was taken in his other field of work, which is a general store. With the help of the previous loan, he bought supplies for the store, which turned out to be very positive as it attracted new customers and improved his sales. With the earnings, he covered his family's needs, paid his debt, and remodeled the area around his store.

loans.use: to buy pedals, chains, patches, tires, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor costs, tractor use and inputs

loans.use: to pay for labor costs, tractor use and inputs

loans.name: Tonh

texts.en:
Tonh, 36 years old, lives with her husband and two children in a small village in the Preah Sdach District, in Prey Veng Province. She has worked in agribusinesses for more than 10 years to ensure the needs of her children who are enrolled in school. Working in the farming business with her husband, Tonh is able to make a net income of USD 4 per day for her family’s daily expenses. 

Currently, Tonh is applying a loan from KIVA to buy solar energy systems to supply the energy to her household. She hopes that, through the loan, she can provide a comfortable lifestyle for all of her children. Finally, she is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to buy solar energy systems

loans.name: Nancy Estamilda

texts.es:
La socia Nancy Estamilda continua con su negocio de snack y cafetería, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de gaseosas, pasteles, galletas entre otros.
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LIDERANDO LAS PALMERAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Partner Nancy Estamilda is still with her snacks and cafeteria business. The partner has had her business for a long time, and she is doing well with it thanks to the work she puts into her business every day. The partner wants to be able to keep working in order to continue supporting her family.

The partner requests a loan to buy soft drinks, cakes, and cookies, among other things. The partner belongs to the Liderando Las Palmeras communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, in the Cusco province and Cusco department. 

Through these means, the partner thanks those who are part of this dream and makes a commitment to comply with payment of her fees in the set period.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cakes, and cookies, among other things.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: Claudia compró sacos de yuca para desarrollar sus procesos de preparación de masa y también compró telas e insumos para su confección. . Su credikiva lo benefició porque compró de contado todo los materiales que necesitaba y quedó con esta sola obligación. Así obtuvo más ventas, por eso dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: Gracias por darnos la oportunidad  y así expandirnos”.  Claudia Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento que invertirá una parte para comprar insumos  de yuca para preparar masa y telas para su otro negocio, la otra parte la invertirá en pagar los impuestos de su vehículo con el cual comercializa la mercancía.
texts.en: Claudia bought sacks of yuca [manioc] to carry out her flour production process, and she also bought fabrics and supplies to make clothing. Her Kiva loan benefited her because she was able to pay cash for all of the materials she needed, and she only had this single financial obligation. In this way, she obtained more sales, and for this reason she would like to say to the Kiva lenders: "Thanks for giving us the opportunity, and in this way we are expanding." Today, Claudia is applying for a new loan which she will invest partly in buying yuca to prepare flour, partly in buying fabrics for her other business, and partly to invest in paying the taxes for her vehicle, which she uses to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy yuca to prepare flour, to buy fabrics for her other business, and to pay taxes on her vehicle which she uses to sell her products.

loans.name: Ximena Alexandra

texts.es: Ximena es madre soltera, ella tiene un hijo de 8 años, Ximena es una joven colombiana que vive ya 14 años en ecuador y actualmente ya tiene la  nacionalidad ecuatoriana, Xinema vive con su hijo en una casa por la que paga arriendo y tambien tiene un local donde funciona su sala de belleza a la que se dedica 4 años y tambien paga arriendo, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de belleza para dar una atencion de buena calidad a sus clientes, Ximena tiene planeado quedarse en Ecuador para siempre y sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ximena is a single mother. She has one 8-year-old child. Ximena is a young Colombian woman who has lived in Ecuador for fourteen years and is now an Ecuadorian national. Ximena lives with her son in a house that she rents. She also pays rent for a commercial space where she runs her beauty salon, where she has worked for four years. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of beauty products in order to provide a high-quality service to her clients. Ximena has plans to stay in Ecuador forever and to provide for her son.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is married with 5 children. Isabel is 52 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Isabel buys and sells dried fish to earn a living, and has had this business for 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. 
She has requested a loan for PHP 45,000 for additional capital.

Isabel has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of dried fish

location.town: Liloy- Baybay Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Marianito

texts.en:
Marianito is married with two children. He is 66 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marianito cares for pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. He has requested a loan to purchase additional piglets and feed.

Marianito has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Marianito hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglet and feeds

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Quimbe is 17 years old and she is the second of five children in the family. Her mother, Arlyn, who is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Quimbe is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the first semester of this four-year course.

Arlyn, Quimbe's mother, is borrowing PHP 10,000 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Quimbe plans to graduate and be gainfully employed, to help her parents.

In the picture, Arlyn (wearing a gray long sleeve) is a member of NWTF who borrowed the said amount to support the studies of her daughter Quimbe (wearing brown shirt).

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Samat's Group

texts.en:
Samat, originally from Moung Russey district in Battambang province, is 54 years old and a mother of one schoolchild.  She earns a living via rice and pineapple farming.  That is the business that she has had for 30 years. 

Samat is a fourth-time borrower, and has formed a group of two with a first time borrower to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Samat  has repaid back her past loans completely and the loans have enabled her to uplift her lifestyle at a good pace. Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR for each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crop. She highly believes that she can gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Irma Moraima

texts.es:
Irma tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con su padre e hijos de 16, 14 y 12 años de edad, en la comunidad Pailaloma perteneciente al Cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Patrón San Miguel  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad  Pailaloma unos 40 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa y se dedican a la agricultura.
Irma  se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva maíz y cria borregos y vacas. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, fertilizantes. La compra lo realiza en San Miguel. Su meta es mejorar la venta de sus animales y la producción de maíz. Su desafío es el clima y las plagas en sus sembríos. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con sus hijos y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Irma is 34 years old, single, and she lives with her father and her children, ages twelve, fourteen and sixteen. They live in the community of Pailaloma in the San Miguel canton, province of Bolívar. She is a member of the Patrón San Miguel solidarity group whose members farm for a living. It is located in Pailaloma, 40 minutes from the co-op office.

Irma makes a living as a farmer, growing corn, and raising sheep and cows. She is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizer, which she will purchase in San Miguel. 

Her goal is to improve sales of her animals and corn production. Her challenges are the climate and infestations in her fields. In her spare time she enjoys being with her children and listening to music.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Thelia

texts.en:
Thelia lives in Tagmanocan, Lazi, Siquijor, Philippines. She is a widow and has 10 children. She never gets tired of supporting their big family. This year, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one.  She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pay her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 for additional capital for fishing. She wants to replace torn fish nets and buy new ones. Through this project, she believes she can raise more income, which will be of help in the expansion of her business. Thelia has found comfort in her financial needs through Paglaum MPC, of which she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment such as fishing nets.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a micro-entrepreneur from Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Coron is one of the tourist spots in the Philippines which was hit by typhoon Haiyan last November 2013. Felina’s business was also affected but life goes on and her business is continuously recovering. She is married to Paulo who works as a driver and they have two children.

Felina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Felina dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes that her family will always stick together even if life is hard. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Analida

texts.es: Análida con su anterir  credikiva compró telas con las cuales elaboró sabanas, tambien compró mercancia como bolsos toallas y calzado. Su credikiva lo benefició porque su tasa de interés es muy baja, sus utilidades tambien se incrmentaron, Ahora tiene mas ingresos e hizo mejoramiento a su vivienda en pintura y acabados. Ella dice a asu fianciadores de Kiva : "Gracias por seguir ayudandola Dios los Bendiga" En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva mediante el cual comprará mercancias calzado, y prendas al pormayor, su compra por volumen le permitirá obtener mejores precios y esto es justamente lo que hace efectiva su inversión.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Analida bought fabric with which she made sheets. She also bought merchandise like bags, towels, and shoes. Her Kiva loan was beneficial because her interest rate is very low. Her profits also increased. Now she has more income and she made improvements to her home, with paint and finishes. She says to her Kiva lenders, "Thank you for continuing to help me. God bless you." 

She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan with which she will buy merchandise like shoes and wholesale clothing. Buying by volume will allow her to obtain better prices and that is exactly what makes her investment effective.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like shoes and wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Bundimasoli Kweyamba Group

texts.en:
Daudi, whose hand is raised in a group, is a 47-year-old, married man, with eight children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Daudi is so hard-working that he grows cocoa and sells fish as another source of income to support his family. He plans to educate his children to high levels and expand his cocoa business. 

Daudi wants a loan to pay school fees for his children.

The extra people in the photo are children of the group members.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Bundikeki Farmers Sacco Ltd Group

texts.en:
Top, whose hand is raised in the group, is a 37-year-old woman, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. When Top realized that there were small savings from her cocoa garden, she opted to use her small savings to start a food produce business, selling rice and beans to earn more daily income. She wants to see her children attain the best education, and to expand her business to a big store. She is challenged by poor seasonal changes for her cocoa growing. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, cocoa, and beans for selling. 

The extra people in the photo are children of the group members.

loans.use: to buy rice, cocoa and beans to sell.

loans.name: María Bersabé

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, saco sus estudios de bachillerato, está casada desde hace 10 años, su esposo trabaja de motorista, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando educación básica  


María es una persona responsable y trabajadora quien decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de comida con la idea de ayudar con los gastos del hogar a su esposo, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado central y le queda a 10 kilómetros de distancia de su casa, para lo cual se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y a las 6 de la mañana emprende viaje en autobús hacia su negocio.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta en el negocio y otros que ya merecen cambio porque están deteriorados por el uso y así poder brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes  

El sueño de María es que el negocio del comedor siga creciendo para poner un restaurante, y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old, and she graduated from high school. She has been married for 10 years, and her husband works as a driver. She has two children who are in primary school. 

María is a responsible and hard-working person who decided to set up her own business selling food, with the aim of helping her husband with the household expenses. Her business is located in the central market, which is 10 kilometers from her house. She gets up at 3 in the morning to take care of the household tasks, and at 6 in the morning she takes a bus to travel to her business. 

The loan will be used to buy kitchen utensils which she needs for her business, as well as other equipment that needs to be replaced because it has deteriorated with use. In this way she will be able to provide better service to her customers. 

María's dream is that her food business will keep growing, so that she can open a restaurant, and also that her children will complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils she needs for her business and other equipment that needs replacing.

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
The Mandzaano Group is made up people from the same neighborhood. They are, on average, 43 years old. They live in Teshie-Accra, and know each other from neighborhood ties. All the people engage in small-scale commerce, selling smoked fish, cloth, scarves and ready-made dresses. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to collaborate with ID-Ghana. They are on their eighth group loan.

Kai has a good reputation selling fish. She plans to use her loan to buy three cartons of fish from the fishermen to sell to customers. She sometimes smokes and sells them, depending on the demand from customers. With her loan, Kai hopes to earn a good monthly profit, which will be reinvested in her business. She is 62 years old, married and has grown children. They will hold each other for responsible for repayment of this loan.

loans.use: to buy three cartons of fish from the fishermen to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to be able to help and fertilize her coffee crop.

loans.name: Kakbe Group

texts.en:
Nahuala is a small town nestled in the hills of the Solola department in Guatemala. The main livelihoods here are agriculture and livestock. 

Up a small dirt road, some cement stairs, and a pathway into a small home, the “Kakbe” Trust Bank members sit and chat in Quiche, the indigenous language of Nahuala. The majority of them wear the typical guipiles (woven blouses) and cortes (woven skirts). In Nahuala, the blouses are known for beautiful patterns and colors. Because of this, all but one member has created a business in the making and selling of these clothes. The women will use the money from their loans to buy traditional back strap looms and threads, and then begin to weave these incredible clothes. 

Pascuala, who is 63 years old, is the only member of the group who does not specialize in traditional clothes. The owner of a small but successful bakery and bread shop in Nahuala, she will use her loan portion to buy flour and other ingredients to keep her business thriving. 

Having grown up together in Nahuala, the nine women of the group have been friends for a long time. They know each other’s pasts and support each other’s futures. Kakbe signifies exactly this to them: 

“It means that, together, we are working to create a better path for ourselves” says Pascuala, the oldest member of the group. “We want everything to go well for ourselves, but also for each other and our families,” she continues. 

Pascuela and the other eight members thank the generous Kiva donors for their help. “We are thankful,” says Pascuela, “because they are helping us so much. We can now do what we have always wanted with this opportunity.”

loans.use: To buy flour and ingredients for a bakery.

loans.name: St Kagwa Women Group

texts.en: Florance is a 30-year-old woman, married with four children, and is a member of the St. Kagwa Women’s Group, living in Kasese, Uganda. She has operated a retail shop business for five years. Florance is a hardworking woman, who fights hard to enlarge her business and to educate her children, despite the challenge of price fluctuations and high license fees. Florance needs a loan to buy glasses, plates, cups, flasks, etc. to sell.

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, cups, flasks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Kweteghekela Women Group

texts.en: Sefuroza, whose hand is raised in the group, is a 56-year-old, married woman with four children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Sefuroza, who grows mainly cocoa, decided to start a small business of selling alcohol and other vegetables, with the savings from the cocoa sales, to improve her household income. She wishes her children to have a better education, and to construct a permanent building for her family. Like any other farmer, she's challenged by poor and harsh weather changes. She is requesting a loan to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Diouma's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 3 femmes fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 17 mai 1997.Ce dernier regroupe des membres qui habitent dans le même village et ceux des environs. Les membres entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité génératrice de revenus l'embouche et le commerce.
Amy debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 47 ans . Elle est mariée mère de 5 enfants dont 2 filles.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 5 brebis et 5 agneaux; elle les engraisse pour une durée de 5 mois pour pouvoir les revendre.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de réinvestir dans son activité d'embouche, de satisfaire les besoin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of three women is part of the "banc villageois" loan association which was created on May 17 1997. It regroups members who live in the same village and those living in the surrounding area. The members have good relations and their income-generating activities are livestock fattening and commerce.

Amy, who is standing on the right and raising her hand in the photo, is 47 years old. She is a married mother of five children, of whom two are girls.

She will use the loan to buy 5 ewes and 5 lambs; she then fattens them for a period of five months before they can be resold.

Profits enable her to reinvest in her livestock fattening activity, and to satisfy her children's needs.

loans.use: buy five ewes and five lambs

loans.name: Kirumya Central Group

texts.en:
Jovia, whose hand is raised in a group, is a 22-year-old, married woman, with four children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

After realizing that her income was very low, she decided to join a group to support herself and her family. She grows cocoa to sell and meet her daily obligations. She dreams of building a good house for her family and buying land to grow more cocoa on a large scale. However, she is affected by unpredictable weather changes. 

Jovia needs a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Nyaibanda Savings & Credit Group

texts.en: Alex is a 34-year-old, married man with children, who deals in produce buying and selling, especially beans in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has also been in agriculture for many years to get additional income. He started buying and selling produce to earn income for improving the livelihood of his family. His hardship is that the business is seasonal, given the fact that farmers depend on rainfall for production and price fluctuations. His vision is to construct his own store. He is a member of a village bank where members, because of lack of security, offer to guarantee one another to get a loan. Alex needs the loan to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Nyabuliko Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Richard, with a hand raised, is a member of a village bank, where members guarantee one another for a loan. He is a 32-year-old, married man with four children, who is in a produce business selling and buying maize in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He also has been in farming for many years. Now he also packs maize for sale. His hardship is that the business is seasonal, given the fact that farmers depend on the availability of rainfall. His vision is to become a market leader of produce. Richard needs the loan to buy produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Henry Fabricio

texts.es: Fabircio es un joven que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, el tiene 18 años de edad y es hurfano ya que su madre y padre  muriron cuando Fabricio era niño, Fabricio solo tiene un hermano mayor con el que se ayudan mutuamente, Fabricio se dedica al comencio de papas juntamente con el suegro de su hermano, y tambien se dedica a trabajar en una paqueña empresa donde elaboran quesos, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercaderia en papas para incrementar su negocio, Fabricio espera que su negocio crezca para mejorar sus ingresos y de aquí cubrir los gastos que implican sacar la licencia profecional ya que esta es la aspiracion de Fabricio.
texts.en:
Fabricio is a young man eager to get ahead; he is 18 years old and an orphan since his mother and father died when he was a child.  Fabricio only has one older brother with whom he exchanges help.  Along with his brother's father-in-law, Fabricio works at selling potatoes, and also works for a small business which makes cheese.  

He will invest the loan in buying potatoes as merchandise to increase his sales.   Fabricio hopes that his business will grow to improve his income and cover the costs to get a professional license, which is what he aspires to do.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Kabende Tukurakurane Group

texts.en:
Lovis is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan. He used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell and onions for planting. After realizing that farming alone could not facilitate him in meeting the daily needs of his family, he decided to venture into clothes selling, maize milling, and retail, in order to generate more income. He faces challenges of machine breakage and inadequate capital. Besides that, he hopes to expand his business to new places. 
Lovis will use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: José Margarito

texts.es:
José de 36  años de edad es agricultor, estudio hasta sexto grado,  por motivos de los bajos recursos económicos le fue imposible continuar, está casado y tiene 2  hijos, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 19 años, trabajo que le enseñaron sus padres después que dejó su estudio, a él se le hace difícil conseguir otro trabajo debido al nivel académico que tiene y es por eso que la agricultura es su fuente de ingreso. 

Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: sulfato, formula, abono, veneno para la plaga, entre otros, que serán los que le ayudaran a obtener mejores resultados en la cosecha y obtener más ganancias.

El sueño a un futuro es ayudarle a sus hijos en el estudio y tenga mayores oportunidades de trabajo, así mismo mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia, ya que son de muy bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Jose, 36 years old, is a farmer and went to school up until the sixth grade. Because he had few economic resources, it was impossible for him to continue. He is married and has 2 children. His partner is a housewife. Since he was 19 years old, Jose has made a living in agriculture, work that his parents taught him after he left his studies. It is difficult for him to get another job because of his level of schooling, and that is why agriculture is his source of income. 

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as sulfate, fertilizer, manure, and poison for pests, among other things, which will help him obtain better crop results and more earnings. The dream for the future is to help his children with their studies and to have better work opportunities, as well as to improve his family's quality of life, because they have very few economic resources.

loans.use: to buy sulfate, fertilizer, manure, and poison for pests.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 34 años de edad es agricultor, estudio hasta cuarto grado, debido a los bajos recursos económicos que vivía junto a sus padres, está casado y tiene 3  hijos, ellos asisten a quinto, segundo y parvularia, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Juan se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 18 años, trabajo que le enseño su padre después que dejó su estudio, a él se le hace difícil conseguir otro trabajo debido al nivel académico que tiene y es por eso que la agricultura es su  fuente de ingreso,  su esposa es quien le ayuda mucho en este trabajo, ambos se levantan muy temprano para hacer las tareas del hogar y luego se disponen  para el campo a una distancia de 2 kilómetros a trabajar en la agricultura. 

Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas tales como: sulfato, abono,  formula, veneno para la plaga, entre otros, que serán los que le ayudaran a obtener mejores resultados en la cosecha, obtener más ganancias y así poder cancelar su crédito a tiempo.
texts.en:
Juan, age 34, is a farmer.  He studied through fourth grade only, because of the poor financial circumstances he shared with his parents.  He is married and has three children.  The children go to fifth grade, second grade, and preschool, and his wife takes care of the home.

Juan has worked as a farmer since he was 18 years old,  the work his father taught him after he left school.  It's hard for him to get any other job because of his low educational level.  That is why farming is his main source of income.   His wife helps him a lot in this work.  Both get up early to do the daily chores at home and then go to the field 2 kilometers away to work at farming.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as sulfate, fertilizer, formula,  and poison for pests among supplies which will help him get a better yield, more earnings,  and be able to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy sulfate, fertilizer, formula, and poison for pests

loans.name: María Eduviges

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad,  sacó sus estudios de bachillerato,  vive junto a su compañero de vida y su madre, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que tiene visión de negocio

María tiene un negocio de bisutería y varios artículos de arreglos florales, negocio en el cual tiene mas de 20 años, decidió aprender la elaboración de flores y otros artículos en unos cursos que estaban impartiendo cerca de su comunidad, desde entonces decidió emprender su propio negocio, el cual día con día va en ascenso, para llegar al lugar debe viajar 20 minutos ya que está a 6 kilómetros de su casa.


El crédito que ella está solicitando será utilizado para capital de trabajo ya que quiere diversificar un poco mas su negocio con mas productos a ofrecer a sus clientes.  


María planea a futuro poner otro negocio, y esforzarse para poder lograrlo.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old, and she completed high school. She lives together with her life partner and her mother. She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who has a vision for her business. 

María has a business selling decorative items and assorted supplies for flower arranging. She has more than 20 years of experience with this business. She decided to learn about flower arranging and other materials in some courses she took that were offered near her community. After that, she decided to open her own business, which she has seen grow day by day. To reach her place of business, she has to travel 20 minutes, since it is 6 kilometers from her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used for working capital, since she would like to diversify her business a little more, with more products to offer to her customers.

In the future, María plans to open another business and work hard to make it a success.

loans.use: to diversify her business a bit more and offer more products to her customers.

loans.name: Asalia

texts.en: Asalia is 46 years old and married with eight children.  She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Asalia needs a loan to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, shovels, a spade, a machete, fertilizer, gloves and a crowbar. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Asalia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, shovels, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tauloto

texts.en:
Tauloto is 43 years old and married, with three children. 

She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Tauloto needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a rake, sprayers, chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, and new gum boots. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014. Tauloto will use the profits from her sales to help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a new wheelbarrow, a rake, sprayers, chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, and new gum boots.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty, an alcohol dealer, is a hard-working married Ugandan woman who also sells oil as her other source of income to cater to her family's needs. 

She desires to educate her children at the university level, but she is challenged by weather changes and high license fees levied on alcohol dealers. However, she is requesting a loan to buy more alcohol to sell.

Betty is a member of St. Mathias Development Group where members guarantee each other in order to acquire a loan.

loans.use: to buy more alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is an 80-year-old widow with ten children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 14 years. Malia needs a loan to buy a large chest freezer, frozen goods, snacks, a small cooler, soft drinks and a bag of sugar. She hopes to save her profits for the future of her grandchildren. She became a member of SPBD in 2001 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a large chest freezer, frozen goods, snacks, a small cooler, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Rosa Clemencia

texts.es: Clemencia vive con su esposo y con sus 2 hijos de 3 y 10 años que se encuentran estudiandon, Clemencia es una señora que se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la crianza de chanchos, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para mejorar su negocio, Clemencia aspira seguir adelante en su negocio para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Clemencia lives with her husband and her two children, ages 3 and 10, who are in school.   Clemencia works at agriculture and raising animals.  For ten years she has been  raising pigs. 

 She will use the loan to buy pigs to improve her business.  Clemencia wants to get ahead in business so that her children can complete their schooling.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Mikole Twimuke Group

texts.en: Edson is a married man with five children, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been operating a canteen selling bread, soap, sugar, and salt, which he started with capital from savings in their group. He obtains additional income from a farming business, growing beans, and maize. He has been member of a village group where members save and guarantee one another to get a loan. He experiences a difficulty of low capital to buy his products, accompanied by high transport costs. His vision is to expand his business. Edson needs the loan to buy soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Taulau

texts.en: Taulau is a 49-year-old, married woman with seven children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Taulau needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, a large pot, a barrel of cooking oil, a new oven and a new gas bottle. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Taulau has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and sugar, a large pot, a barrel of cooking oil, a new oven and a new gas bottle.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is 65 years old and married, with four children. 

She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Luisa needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, frozen goods, snacks, cartons of cigarettes, and a new hanging scale. 

Luisa hopes to save her profits for the betterment of her business. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refrigerator, frozen goods, snacks, cartons of cigarettes, and a new hanging scale.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora sells new clothes. She is a hardworking married Ugandan woman who also rents wedding gowns as her other source of income to cater to her family needs. 

She desires to educate her children, but she is challenged by inadequate capital. However, she is getting credit to buy new clothes.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is 56 years old and married with seven children.  She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 12 years. Kalala needs a loan to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar, a tiller, sprayers and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Kalala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a machete, a tiller etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en: Lisa is 34 years old and married with four children. She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for four years. Lisa needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, snacks, cases of soft drinks, a new hanging scale and a sack of onions. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a chest freezer, snacks, soft drinks, a new hanging scale and a sack of onions.

loans.name: Talainuu

texts.en: Talainuu is a 43-year-old widow with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for nine years. Talainuu needs a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a tiller, a crowbar, gloves and new gumboots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2005. Talainuu will use the profits from her sales to renovate her house and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a tiller, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Vitolina

texts.en: Vitolina is 56-years-old and single with one child. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Vitolina needs a loan to buy insect poison, sprayers, a new tiller, a crowbar, fertilizer and a new wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Vitolina will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, sprayers, a new tiller, a crowbar, fertilizer and a new wheelbarrow

loans.name: Lotolagi

texts.en: Lotolagi is a 57-year-old widow with eight children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 15 years. Lotolagi needs a loan to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, gloves and new gumboots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Lotolagi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family’s weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a crowbar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tauilo

texts.en: Tauilo is a 39-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a canteen and sells a variety of snacks and drinks in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Tauilo needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, scones, a bottle of coffee, a bag of sugar, foam cups and a new boiler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tauilo has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, scones, a bottle of coffee, a bag of sugar, foam cups and a new boiler

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia is a 30-year-old, single woman with six children.  She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Sesilia needs a loan to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar and new gumboots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Sesilia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, sprayers, a tiller, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.en:
Nahuala is a beautiful town in the highlands of Guatemala. The town has a balance of traditional and modern.
