After being discharged, he went to work as a truck driver for a domestic freight company, which is where he stayed for the next 14 years until the business shut down. Mike saw this as an opportunity rather than a setback, buying up his former employer’s old equipment and using his connections from years of working in the trucking industry as a cross-country deliverer to provide a ready client base. 

Sharon, Mike’s wife of 29 years, joined him in running the business. She eventually learned to drive a rig, too, accompanying Mike on long hauls until they started fostering kids.

Running a business is not all roses and sunshine, as Mike and Sharon will tell you. After overcoming skyrocketing fuel prices, cumbersome State regulations, a sour economy and exploding engines, Mike and Sharon were forced to lose their home in order to keep their business, following bankruptcy proceedings caused by a large client’s default.

Once again, Mike and Sharon persevered, and now their business is on a firmer footing than ever due to the growth of a loyal client, Stone Brewing. They will use their Kiva loan to buy a trailer to allow them to meet the demands for their services. With this last bit of investment, Double Time Express is poised to become a sustainable business that Mike and Sharon can pass on to their kids.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to allow them to meet the demand for their services

loans.name: Roció Ivon

texts.es:
Rocío es una joven de 23 años de edad, emprendedora y luchadora con visión de negocio, está soltera, actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos.  

Rocío tiene negocio de prestación de servicios de un cyber y venta de útiles escolares, negocio que decidió emprender hace 3 años junto a su hermano ya que ella estudió técnico en computación, el negocio que posee se encuentra a medio kilómetro de distancia de su casa, por lo cual camina aproximadamente 10 minutos hacia su trabajo.

El préstamo que ella está solicitando lo necesita para comprar una vitrina para exhibir los productos que tiene para ofrecer a sus clientes ya que también desea surtirlo un poco mas, y además quiere comprar una maquina laminadora ya que le hace falta.

Ella planea a futuro seguir estudiando, asistir a la universidad y sacar su carrera ya que solo cuenta con un técnico, además desea mejorar su negocio y tener un local propio ya que alquila, por último le gustaría casarse y formar su propia familia.
texts.en: Rocio is a young 23 year old girl, enterprising and hardworking, with business vision. She is single and currently lives with her parents and siblings. Rocio has a business of providing computer services and selling school items. She decided to start this business 3 years ago with her brother, since she studied computers. Her business is located half a kilometer away from her house, so she walks approximately 10 minutes to her job. She is requesting the loan to buy a display cabinet to exhibit the products she has for her customers, because she also wants to stock it up a little more. She also wants to buy a laminating machine that she needs. She plans to keep on studying in the future, to attend college and graduate with a career, because she only has a technical certificate. She also wants to improve her business and have her own place of work, since she is currently renting. Finally, she would like to get married and form her own family.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet to exhibit the products, and also she wants to buy a laminating machine that she needs.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene worked as a training manager for a large corporation until he was laid off a few years back. He had a hard time finding a new job in the midst of the recession, with employers saying that he was overqualified for the positions they had available. After six months, he landed a bartender job, which was the catalyst that sparked him to start his own business.

Getting back into the food service industry as a bartender inspired Rene to consider starting his own business.  His first job was as a cashier at Jack in the Box when he was 17, and through the years, he has held many jobs dealing with food preparation and foodservice management.  He decided to take these 22 years of experience and open Tortifruit, a deli specializing in Mexican style sandwiches and fruit salads. 

Rene and his wife Escamilla run the shop, using only top quality ingredients to set Tortifruit apart from the competition.  Rather than ordering large quantities of wholesale bread and produce, they buy small quantities daily so that they only serve the freshest ingredients.  Rene loves working in foodservice, because it is always a challenge. No two days are ever alike. He also loves the way food makes people feel comfortable and at home. 

Business is growing steadily for Rene and Escamilla and they have reached a point where they need additional equipment to keep up with demand. They will use their Kiva loan to purchase another blender, as well as a refrigerated sandwich prep table.

Tortifruit has already been embraced by the local community, and Rene hopes these improvements will help his shop become the number one Chamango/Torta in the region.  Ultimately, what Rene and Escamilla seek is their own slice of the American Dream, believing that their dedication (15 hour days) to their business will eventually provide them with more independence and time to spend with their kids.

loans.use: to purchase another blender, as well as a refrigerated sandwich prep table

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es un hombre trabajador, tiene 47 años de edad y vive en Huaraz junto a su familia.
Tiene 3 hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes siempre ha luchado para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 8 años viene dedicándose a la venta de hilos y sogas en la Zona comercial de la ciudad de Huaraz, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, emprendedor, dedicado a su labor y muy amable.
Cesar está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos con las ventas y así seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su vivienda propia".
texts.en:
Cesar is a 47-year-old working man who lives in Huaraz with his family. He has 3 children who are his pride and joy, and he has always strived to provide a better future for them. 

For over 8 years, he has been selling yarn and rope in the commercial area in the city of Huaraz. He is doing very well because he is very responsible, enterprising, dedicated to his work, and very friendly. 

Cesar is grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they give him to purchase merchandise will grow his business. This way he will get more income from sales and he can continue striving to fulfill his dream: "Having his own home."

loans.use: to buy merchandise to implement his thread business.

loans.name: Tangie

texts.en:
For Tangie, the stress of her corporate lifestyle took its toll until she found herself with a serious medical condition.  This was a wake-up call for her and she knew she had to make a lifestyle change.  She began researching living a more healthy, holistic lifestyle and learned about how beauty products can affect one’s health.  

She combined her love for cooking with some online research and began cooking her own personal care products, starting with hair products and eventually moving into creating body creams and soaps.  Her family and friends eventually caught wind of her newfound hobby and began asking if she would sell them some of her all-natural creations. Tangireen Naturals was born.

Tangie launched her business with a mission to make all natural personal care products affordable to the masses, challenging the common perception that all-natural means more expensive.  She has seen how her line of natural skin products cures various skin ailments, such as acne, as well as improves the quality of life of patients with more serious ailments.

This entrepreneur is now ready to bring her business to the next level and share her line of products with the masses.  She will use her $5,000 Kiva loan to purchase more ingredients to make her skin products and to market her budding business.

With four children, Tangie ultimately hopes that her business will be able to build a legacy for her family, and that they will continue the business that she has started.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make her skin products and to market her budding business.

loans.name: Fanny Del Rosario

texts.es: Fanny es una señora colombiana que vive  12 años en Ecuador, ella comenta que se vino a Ecuador ya que un dia hubo un enfrentamiemto donde hubo 3 muertos alado de su casa y que ella presencio este desagradable suceso, al paso de unos dias llegaron a la casa de Fanny los familiares de los muertos a obligarle a Fanny y a su esposo para que vayan de testigos y que asi los acosaban diariamente, este fue el motivo por el que decidiaron salir de Colombia, Fanny se dedica a la crianza de vacas, y su esposo trabaja al jornal, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca para mejorar sus ingresos y educar a su hija de 14 años y apoyar en los gastos que tiene su hija de 20 años.
texts.en:
Fanny is a Colombian woman who has lived in Ecuador for 12 years.  She comments that she came to Ecuador because one day there was a fight where there were 3 people left dead at the side of her house, and she witnessed this terrible incident.  After a few days the relatives of the dead people came to Fanny's house and demanded that she and her husband become witnesses, and they pursued them daily towards this end.  This was the reason that they decided to leave Colombia.  

Fanny has a business raising cows and her husband works as a farmhand.  She will use this loan to buy a cow to increase her income so that she can educate her 14 year-old daughter and help her 20 year-old daughter with her expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is 47 years old and single.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Dolores requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for 10 years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Ma. Dolores would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Rosebie

texts.en:
Rosebie is a married woman and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Rosebie has a business, selling footwear in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock of footwear to sell.

She has been in the footwear business for six years. Rosebie would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of footwear to sell

loans.name: Teodesia

texts.en:
Teodesia is 53 years old and married. She has two children, who are currently in school. Teodesia works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase more stock to sell, like soft drinks, detergent, soap, shampoo, canned goods, and bread. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as those just mentioned.

In the future, Teodesia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, like soft drinks, soap, canned goods, and bread.

loans.name: 30 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres ocias emprendedoras, una de ella es la coordinadora, señora Lidia de 64 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo, es propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio, este negocio lo impulso hace cuarenta años, cuando le realizo un préstamo a una prima y compro una máquina y tela desde entonces ha logrado mantener el negocio, y el crédito lo solicita para la compra de rollos de telas, entretela, hilo, cinta de mantequilla, dacron, tela sincatex, etc., con el fin de aumentar su clientela. Las otras socias son, la señora Petrona de 54 años de edad, propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio con una experiencia de 20 años, y la señora Socorro de 62 años de edad, propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
This communal bank has 3 enterprising members.  One of them is the coordinator, Lidia, who is 64 years old, married, and is the mother of a son.  She owns a dressmaking workshop that is located in her home.  She has run this business for 40 years.  She started out with a loan from a cousin, and she bought a sewing machine and fabric.  Ever since, she has kept the business running.  She is requesting a loan to buy rolls of fabric, interfacing, thread, satin ribbon, Dacron, Syncatex (a brand of polyester fabric), etc., with the goal of increasing her customer base.  

The other members of this group are: Petrona, 54, who has 20 years of experience with a sewing workshop in her home, and Socorro, 62, who's had a grocery store business in her home for 4 years.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Teodora is married. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

Teodora requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. Teodora has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF, to sustain her activity.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock, vitamins, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 30 years old and married. With her three children currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more items to sell in her general store. Teresita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, biscuits, juice, coffee, detergent, soap, and shampoo.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store, such as snack foods, biscuits, and juice

loans.name: Elisa Raquel

texts.es:
Elisa es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante sola, para poder brindar un mejor futuro a su hijo. Sin embargo, eso no fue impedimento. Desde hace varios años trabaja en los diferentes Fundos Agrícolas de la Zona de Ica y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y con muchos deseos de superación.
Elisa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una lavadora para poder iniciar un pequeño negocio de lavandería, con esto obtendrá un ingreso adicional, el que podrá ahorrar para más adelante cumplir su gran sueño: "Tener su casa propia".
texts.en:
Elisa is an enterprising women, she is 31 years old, a single mother, and lives in Ica with her family.

As a single mother, she had to look for a way to get ahead alone, to be able to provide a better future for her child. However, this was not an impediment. 

For the past few years, she has worked in various farms in the Inca region and it is going very well for her since she is very responsible, hard-working, honest and has a strong desire to get ahead.

Elisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have offered her, she will be able to purchase a washing machine to open a small laundromat business, and with this get additional income, which she will be able to save so in the future she can achieve her biggest dream: to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase a washing machine to open a small laundromat business

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 34 years old and married with one child. She has a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years selling a variety of items such as canned goods, juice, soft drinks, cookies, vinegar, cooking oil, shampoo, etc.

Ana Marie is applying for a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her store. She is working hard to give her family a great future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 34 years old, married and has three children who are in school. For the past nine years she has worked hard selling fruit in the Philippines to make a living.

Analiza is applying for a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fruit to sell. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 20 years old and is the sixth of six children in the family. His mother Lucresia, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Maria Fe is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course.

Lucresia, Maria Fe's mother, is borrowing PHP 6,900 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Maria Fe plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
Eulogio de 65 años de edad, no asistió a la escuela debido a que tenia que trabajar, está acompañado y la esposa se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos, aunque por motivos de una caída ella perdió la memoria desde hace 2 años, tiempo que tiene el cliente de cuidarla, 3 de sus hijos están en los Estados Unidos, dos de ellos viven con él y le ayudan en los trabajos, a cuidar el ganado, a peinar los potreros, a cultivo de maíz, frijol y el pasto para el ganado, además con Eulogio viven 5 nietos y se desplaza en caballo hasta el lugar donde trabaja. 

 El presente crédito lo necesita para cultivar maíz y frijol, preparar los potreros para el pasto de su ganado, y aplicar el abono, los fertilizantes al cultivo.

Sueña con dejarles un terreno a sus hijos para que puedan vivir y trabajar en lo propio.
e
texts.en:
Eulogio is 65 years old and did not go to school as he had to work. Eulogio is married; his wife used to look after the household chores but, following a fall two years ago, she lost her memory. Since then Eulogio has been looking after her. Three of the couple's children live in the United States, while two still live at home and help with Eulogio's work, looking after cattle and the fields, growing corn and beans, and growing grass for the cattle. Eulogio also has five grandchildren who live with him. He travels to his work on horseback.

Eulogio needs this loan to grow corn and beans, apply fertilisers and manure to crops, and to prepare pastures for cattle to graze.

Eulogio dreams of leaving his children land in order for them to live and work it for themselves.

loans.use: to grow corn and beans, apply fertilisers and manure to crops, and to prepare pastures for cattle to graze.

loans.name: Estoy Confiando Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora Zelenia de 28 años de edad, acompañada, se dedica a la hecha y venta de nacatamales en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años, este negocio lo impulso hace cuatro años con un fondo que tenía ahorrado y otra parte le ayudo su compañero de vida, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de quintal de maíz, carne de cerdo, naranja agrias, arroz, leña, achiote, tomate, cebolla, mecate, hojas de chagüites, etc., con esta inversión sus ingresos mejorarán. Las otras socias es la señoras Silvia de 36 años de edad, comerciante de ropa en su comunidad, y la señora Victoria de 55 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de sopa de mondongo en su domicilio, con cuatro años de experiencia de estar ofreciendo este servicio, lo que le ha permitido tener clientela fija.
texts.en: This solidarity group is comprised of three hardworking members and is coordinated by Zelenia, 28 years old and partnered, who has worked preparing and selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales) in her home for the past four years. This business got its first boost four years ago with some funds that she had saved and her life partner helped her with the other part. She needs the loan to purchase a quintal (100 lbs) of corn, pork, sour oranges, rice, firewood, annatto, tomato, onion, twine, banana leaves, etc. With this investment, her income will increase.  The other members are Silvia, 36, clothing merchant in the community, and Victoria, 55, who works selling mondongo soup in her home, with four years of experience offering this service, which has permitted her to have regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase a quintal (100 lbs) of corn, pork, sour oranges, rice, firewood, annatto, tomato, onion, rope, banana leaves, etc.

loans.name: Colibri Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas y coordinado por la señora Darling de 28 años de edad, acompañada, se dedica a la venta de frijol al por mayor en el mercado de la municipalidad, este es uno de los productos más demandado por la población, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de frijol.  Las otras socias son las señoras, Aurora de 51 años de edad propietaria de un taller de carpintería en su domicilio desde hace cinco años, y Ericka de 23 años de edad, propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio, el cual fue heredado por su papa y trabaja con sus dos hermanos.
texts.en:
This group has three hard-working members, and is coordinated by 28-year-old Darling. She has a partner and makes a living selling beans in bulk at the municipal market. Beans are one of the most sought-after products locally. This loan will be used to buy a hundredweight of beans.

The other members of the group are 51-year-old Aurora who has owned a carpentry workshop in her home for five years, and 23-year-old Ericka, owner of a sewing workshop that she runs out of her home. Ericka inherited this workshop from her father, and works with her two brothers.

loans.use: to buy a hundredweight of beans.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa, 32, is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Vanessa requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional items to sell, like toothpaste, sanitary pads, milk, cooking oil, and canned goods. She has been in the general store business for four years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan, to further build her business.

In the future, Vanessa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like toothpaste, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 32 years old and married with four children. For the past five years she has operated her sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She also earns additional money by selling bananas.

Jenelyn has borrowed several times from NWTF before this loan. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her store.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Sayuni

texts.en: Sayuni is a married Ugandan female living in Masindi. Her main business is to sell veterinary services and animal drugs to livestock farmers. She started the business to enable her get more income. She wants a loan to buy animal drugs to sell. She hopes to educate her children despite the challenge of competition and high license fees.

loans.use: to buy animal drugs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil, and cooking seasoning to expand her business.

loans.name: Dolores Mauricio

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 31 años de edad, es bachiller, está soltero y vive con el primo y la esposa del primo, y les ayuda con los gastos del hogar.

Dolores  es agricultor desde que tenia 12 años de edad, cuando llegaba de la escuela le ayudaba al primo en el cultivo del maíz, cuando terminó bachillerato un amigo suyo le ayudó a conseguir trabajo, es así como ahora ya tiene 3 años de trabajar como vigilante en una universidad, y trabaja de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM. 

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas, él comprará tres sacos de abono y pagará quien le ayude a arar la tierra, ya que solo los días libres que él tiene trabaja la agricultura, esto le ayudará mucho ya que tendrá mas ingresos cuando saque los cultivos.

Sus sueños son que Dios le preste vida para seguir trabajando y algún día seguir estudiando alguna carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Dolores is 31 years old. He completed high school and is now single and living with his cousin and cousin's wife. Dolores helps them with household costs.

Dolores has been a farmer since he was 12 years old. When he came home from school he used to help his cousin to grow corn. After leaving high school, a friend helped him to find work and now he has been working as a university security guard for three years. Dolores works from 6am until 4pm.

Dolores needs this loan in order to buy farming supplies (three bags of manure) and to pay a worker to help him plough the field. Dolores needed this help as he can only do his farming work on days when he is not working as a security guard. This loan will be of great help as, with crops, Dolores' income is greater.

Dolores' dreams are that God gives him life in order to continue working and one day study at university.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (three bags of manure) and to pay a worker to help him plough the field.

loans.name: Rocio Yaqueline

texts.es: Rocio tiene 20 años de edad, ella es colombiana y vive con su esposo y su hija de 3 meses en una casa en la que pagan arriendo, Rocio estaba estudiando y por motivo de que tubo su hija dejo sus estudios, su esposo se dedica la cuadrilla, el credito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para ayudarse en los gastos del hogar, Rocio aspira mejorar su negocio para vienestar de su hija y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en: Rocio is 20 years old. She is Colombian and lives with her husband and three-month-old daughter in a rented house. Rocio was studying but, after having her daughter, left her studies. Rocio's husband is a security guard. This loan will be invested in buying chickens, in order to help with household costs. Rocio aspires to improving her business for her daughter's well-being and to improve quality of life in her household.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Freedom Group

texts.en:
Atswei operates a fish business to earn an income. She is 51, married, and has two children-- two are still in school. She has been engaged in her business for three years, working from 8 A.M. to 6 P.M. each working day. She is able to earn a small return each month.

She is requesting her seventh loan through ID-Ghana. With her previous credit, which she has repaid in full, she bought fish. She used her increased profit to cover family food expenses and school fees. She believes that with Kiva's help, her business will grow and her family's life will improve. Atswei will use this loan to buy fish and sell it to customers. Her ambition is to greatly improve her family's standard of living.

She will share this loan with her loan group partner, Atswei An. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish and sell to customers.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 45 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos, en casa propia pero no poseen luz eléctrica, el trabaja en una empresa privada con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: José, 45 years old, lives with his wife and children, in his own house, but they don't have electricity. He works in a private business and with what he earns from his work, he manages to pay some household expenses.  José is asking for a loan to purchase a solar lamp since in the community where he lives, no one has electricity and with what he earns, he can't get it. The lamp is a charging station with solar energy panels in the form of a light that is used in the homes in the rural areas where they don't have electricity.  With this purchase, he will benefit with his family, since at night they will have their own light.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 31 years old and married with three children. For the past six years she has run her sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She also earns money raising pigs.

Marissa has borrowed and successfully paid off five previous loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more stock for her store such as canned goods, beer, soft drinks, cookies, detergent, soap, coffee, etc.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Razelle

texts.en:
Razelle, 43 years old, married and with 2 children, owns and manages a small food stall in their community which sells mostly food for breakfast. This business has been their family's bread and butter for more than 12 years now. Razelle started with only one breakfast menu which she displays on a small makeshift table in front of their house. With diligence, her business slowly improved and specially with the loans provided to her by SEED.

Currently, Razelle has been able to have a small space in front of their house converted as dining area for customers. She is also able to sell at least 4 breakfast menus which she sells from 1:00 to 10:00 a.m. every day. With the improvement in the business space, Razelle's stall started attracting more customers. Staff from a nearby hospital, as well as patient's watchers began patronizing her business.

On her 2nd loan now to SEED, Razelle plans to repair and buy furnishings such as tables, chairs, plates and other dining supplies to cater to the growing number of her customers. With good prospects from her business, Razelle is hopeful to continuously send her son to college.

loans.use: To repair and buy tables, chairs, and dining supplies for her food stall to accommodate increasing number of customers

loans.name: Wil Alfredo

texts.es:
Wil de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 3 hijos y solo 2 de ellos van van a la escuela. 

Wil se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a trabajar prestando servicios de transporte con mota-taxi, pues anteriormente trabajaba con otra persona, pero llegó un momento en que le ofrecían una moto-taxi en venta a lo que él no dudo para comprarla, aunque no tenia el dinero, pero sacó un crédito, para pagarla, y desde esa fecha la situación económica le mejoró.

Él solicita este crédito para reparar la moto-taxi pues la tiene descompuesta, y no tiene el dinero para repararla.

Su sueño es hacer mas grande su casa, para darle mayor comodidad a su familia, además apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien, y a futuro también comprar otras moto-taxis para obtener mayores ingresos, y darle mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Wil, 30 years old, studied up to the sixth grade, is partnered, and his partner takes care of the household tasks. He has 3 children and only 2 of them go to school.

Wil has worked for a long time proving transportation services in his motorcycle taxi.  He previously worked with another person, but there was a time when someone offered to sell him a motorcycle taxi. He didn't hesitate to buy it, even though he didn't have the money, but he took out a loan to pay for it, and from then, his economic situation has improved. 

He asks for this loan to repair his motorcycle taxi since it isn't working and he doesn't have the money to repair it.

His dream is to enlarge his house, to make it more comfortable for his family, and also to support his children so they can study, and in the future also to purchase additional motorcycle taxis to have more income, and provide more comfort for his family.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi since it is in not working and he doesn't have the money to repair it.

loans.name: Jorge Fernando

texts.es: Jorge es un joven muy activo y trabajador, el tiene  27 años de edad y vive con sus padres y una hermana que esta estudiando, Jorge se dedica en sus tiempos libres a la crianza de chanchos y a la crianza y venta de perros de raza, Jorge va a invertir el credito el la compra de chanchos para ayudarse en los gastos de sus estudios, Jorge aspira mejorar su negocio y de estos ingresos lograr terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Jorge is an active and hard-working young man. He is 27 years old and lives with his parents and his sister, who is a student. Jorge works in his free time raising pigs and raising and selling pedigree dogs. Jorge will invest his loan in the purchase of pigs to help him with his student expenses. Jorge aspires to improve his business and from this income, be able to finish his university degree.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es: José de 34 años de edad, es una persona amable, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su trabajo y a su familia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, Jose solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas,  etc. y poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 34 year old José is a friendly person, a worker, and is very dedicated to his work and to his family. He has worked growing corn for 20 years, selling his products in the different markets that can be found close to where he lives. With what he earns from his sales he is able to pay for some household necessities. José is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc. and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Norma  Beatriz

texts.es: Norma de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar  algunos gastos de su hogar, Norma solicita un crédito  para la compra de productos como: granos básicos, detergentes, jabón, refrescos, golosinas, sopas, aceite, etc. y así surtir mas la tienda y poder obtener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 36 year old Norma lives in her own house with her children. She owns a small store located within her house. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she sells at good prices. With what she earns she is able to pay for household expenses. Norma is asking for a loan to buy products such as: grains, detergents, soap, soda, candy, soup, oil, etc. to better supply the store and to be able to earn a better income to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grains, detergents, soap, soda, candy, soup, oil, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lilian works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear and native mats. Lilian is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carla Karen

texts.en:
Carla Karen is 24 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, bath soap, canned goods, coffee, etc., to sell. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

Carla Karen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, bath soap, canned goods, coffee, etc., to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 42 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as milk, canned goods, cooking oil, milk, cereals, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is 37 years old and married with two children.

Dioscora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from food vending.

Dioscora aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Christine Mary is 16 years old and is the fourth of four children in the family. Her mother Marilyn, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her buy and sell of bananas business in the Philippines.

Christine Mary is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Marilyn, Christine Mary's mother, is borrowing PHP 10,300 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Christine Mary plans to help her family to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic has four children and is a member of NWTF. To earn an income she buys and sells pigs.

At eighteen years old Mary Ann is the youngest in the family. She is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Accounting and is currently in the second of a four-year program in college.

Marivic is applying for a 17,572 PHP loan to pay tuition fees for her daughter for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year. Mary Ann plans to graduate and become gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Renebeth

texts.en:
Renebeth is a member of NWTF and supports her family through her sari sari, or general store in the Philippines. Jobeth is sixteen years old and is Renebeth’s only child. She is studying to obtain a Bachelor of Science degree in Office Administration and is currently in the first year of a four-year program at her college.

Renebeth is applying for a 13,150 PHP loan to pay tuition fees for Jobeth for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year. When she graduates, Jobeth plans to become gainfully employed and help her parents live well.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a selling mangoes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers. In the future, Sherlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more mangoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, oil, bags, lime, etc. to make tortillas and be able to continue with her business.

loans.name: Ricardo Hermogenes

texts.es:
Ricardo de 69 años de edad es agricultor, estudio hasta primer grado, debido a los bajos recursos económicos le fue imposible continuar sus estudios, es padre soltero de 3 hijos.

Ricardo se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganaderia desde hace 51 años aproximadamente, estos trabajos se los enseño su padre para que se defendiera en la vida, ya que no le pudo dar estudio, a él se le hace difícil conseguir otro trabajo debido al nivel académico que tiene y es por eso que la agricultura  y la ganadería son su  fuente de ingreso.

Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de 2 novillos pequeños de repasto para cuidarlos, amanzarlos  y venderlos cuando ya estén convertidos en toros,  para cancelar el crédito y de la ganancia cubrir algunas necesidades pendientes.
El sueño a un futuro es mejorar la calidad de vida par él y su familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 69 years old and works in agriculture. Due to low economical resources, it was impossible for him to continue his education and he only studied up to the first grade. He is a single father of 3 children. 

Ricardo has made a living from agriculture and cattle raising for approximately 51 years. His dad taught him how to do these jobs so that he could defend himself in life, given that he could not give him an education.  It is difficult for him to find another job because of the academic level he possesses, that is why agriculture and cattle raising are his only source of income. 

He will use the loan to purchase two young grazing cattle to take care of them, fatten them, and sell them when they are grown bulls in order to cancel his loan and, from the profit, cover some unmet needs. 

His dream for the future is to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to purchase two young grazing cattle

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en: Sambat’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sambat makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs​, her son also does extra work as factory worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Thang's Group

texts.en: Thang’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thang makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

texts.en: Hieng’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Cham province in Cambodia. Hieng makes a living cultivating rice and selling fish to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: El Triangulo Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres socias laboriosas, es coordinado por la señora María Félix de 58 años de edad, propietaria de un taller de costura en su domicilio desde hace veintiocho años, sus productos los comercializa principalmente en el hospital de la municipalidad, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de telas, elásticos, y darle mantenimiento a la maquinaria. Otra de las socias, es la señora Ileana de 22 años de edad dedicada a la venta de cosméticos a los pobladores de su comunidad, y la señora Ada de 41 años de edad comerciante de ropa en su comunidad desde hace ocho años.
texts.en:
This committed group is made up of three hardworking women coordinated by 58-year old Sra. María Félix who has owned a sewing business located in her home for 28 years. Most of her products are sold in the municipal hospital.

The loan María Félix is seeking will be used to buy fabric and elastic, and to service her sewing machine.

The other members of the group are 22-year old Sra. Ileana who sells cosmetics to people in her community, and 41-year old Sra. Ada who has sold clothing in her community for eight years.

loans.use: buy fabric and elastic, and to service her sewing machine

loans.name: Los Tres Amigos Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por cinco socios exitosos, lo coordina la señora Martha de 42 años de edad, soltera y comerciante de ropa nueva en la frontera sur del país, este negocio lo impulso hace seis años, cuando decidió abandonar el trabajo para impulsar dicho negocio de la liquidación obtenida y así convertirse en una microempresaria emprendedora, el crédito lo solicita para invertir en mercadería como es pantalones para damas, pantalones para caballeros, ropa de niños, talladores, blusas, ropa interior, etc. Los otros integrantes son el señor Luis de 44 años de edad, propietario de una barbería en su domicilio, y las señoras Aimee de 22 años de edad propietaria de una tienda de ropa y cosméticos en su domicilio, Valeria de 29 años de edad quien comercializa ropa nueva en su comunidad y Ofelia de 20 años de edad, comerciante de ropa nueva a los pobladores de su comunidad y compañero de la universidad, para cubrir gastos de la carrera universitaria.
texts.en: This solidarity group is made of five successful members, and is coordinated by Martha, 42 years old, single, and a merchant of new clothing on the southern border of the country. This business began six years ago, when she decided to leave her job to start this business from the settlement she got, and in that way make herself into an enterprising small businesswoman. The credit she requests is for women's pants, men's pants, children's clothing, spaghetti strap tops, blouses, underwear, etc. The other members are Luis, 44 years old, owner of a barbershop in his home, and Aimee, 22 years old, and owner of a clothing and cosmetic shop in her home, Valeria, 29 years old, who sells new clothing in her community, and Ofelia, 20 years old, a new clothing merchant to the residents of her community and university student, to pay for the costs of her university degree.

loans.use: to purchase women's pants, men's pants, children's clothing, spaghetti strap tops, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a direct-selling personal collection business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more products from personal collection to sell. Shehas been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products for the personal collection to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Chevy is 20 years old and is second of five children in the family. His mother Vilma, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Chevy is studying for the bachelor of science in elementary education and is currently in the third year of this four-year course. Vilma, Chevy's mother, is borrowing PHP 9,400 to pay for tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

Chevy plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Cindy Theressa is 19 years old and is sixth of six children in the family. Her mother, Teresita, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her general store business in the Philippines.

Cindy Theressa is studying for the Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the fourth year of this four-year course. Teresita, Cindy Theressa's mother, is borrowing PHP 5,000 to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Cindy Theressa plans to help her parents to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to for tuition fees

loans.name: Herminia De La Cruz Baltierra's Group

texts.en:
Herminia, Victoriano and Marcela live in the “Cabeza de Arroyo Granizo” community in the municipality of Xochistlahuaca, located in the state of Guerrero. The thing about this community is that very few people have the privilege to access electricity, and this is not the case for Herminia and her group.  

Currently, Herminia mostly devote her time to crafts, but she has to stop working at night given the lack of electricity, this is why she is sure that by acquiring a solar lighting system, she and her family will be able to extend their productive hours and therefore achieve an increase in their income.  

In addition, they will be able to save some money since they currently spend a large percentage of their income on alternative energy sources such as diesel and candles.

loans.use: to acquire a solar home system to extend their productive hours doing handcrafts during nighttime.

location.town: Cabeza de Arroyo Granizo, Xochistlahuaca, Guerrero

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living  selling fish and eggs from her home, she also does extra work as farm to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Loeum's Group

texts.en: Loeum’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Loeum makes a living cultivating rice and doing extra work as a farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Armando Gomez Morales' Group

texts.en:
Armando, Juan and Florencia liven in the “Rancho San Francisco” community located in the state of Guerrero, which is a very poor community with almost no access to electricity.

Armando and his family have devoted their lifetime to the crafts and to field work, this is why they all have to face the same problem of not having a constant income because the money they receive from these activities depends on the prices of the products at the time and other factors.

Given the lack of electricity in their community, they usually purchase alternative lighting sources such as diesel and candles. This is not only expensive but impractical. This is why they are sure that by acquiring a solar lighting system, they will be able to save some money and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to improve their families’ quality life and increase their productive hours at nighttime

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and her sons also work as farm laborers to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Virginia Baltazar Lopez's Group

texts.en:
Virginia, Celia, and Ines have lived in the “Tierra Colorada” community in the municipality of Ometepec, located in the state of Guerrero their whole lives, and have been friends since they were kids.

Viriginia and her family began harvesting fields since they were very young and this is why currently harvesting and crafts have become their main source of income. They all have to face the same problem of not having a constant income.

Given the lack of electricity in their community, they usually spend a great percentage of their income on alternative lighting sources such as diesel and candles. This is why they are sure that by purchasing a solar home system, they will be able to save some money and improve the family economy by performing productive activities once the sun has set.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system to improve their families’ quality life and replace hazardous lighting sources.

loans.name: Maria Mateo Adelaida's Group

texts.en:
Maria, Maria and Juana live in the “Tierra Colorada”, which is a small community located in the state of Guerrero far away from the electrical grid, so they don´t have access to affordable, good quality and reliable lighting and electricity. 

Maria has devoted a lifetime to crafts, especially embroidery and knitting, this is why she has to face the problem of not having a constant income because she can only collect money when she sells her crafts.

Given the lack of electricity in their community, she usually spends a great percentage of her families income on alternative lighting sources such as diesel and candles. The system they will acquire with your help will replace diesel and candles, and will allow them to have quality lighting for productive proposes and save some money.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to extend their productive hours making crafts during nighttime.

loans.name: Toeur's Group

texts.en: Toeur’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Toeur makes a living cultivating rice and raising pigs to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sam Ol's Group

texts.en: Sam Ol’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sam Ol makes a living cultivating rice, raising pigs and selling groceries from her home. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vannissa

texts.en:
Vannissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She is 31 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Vannissa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 30 years. Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 23 años de edad, está soltero y aun vive con sus padres y 5 hermanos, y está sacando los estudios con mucho esfuerzo.


 Manuel  trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, su padre siempre lo llevaba a trabajar, actualmente Manuel está estudiando 8tavo grado, él va a la escuela por las tardes y por las mañanas va al campo a cultivar la tierra, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos y viaja a pie su papá y un hermano se involucran y trabajan 6 a 12 de la mañana.



El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar 6 sacos de abono y una botella de veneno esto le servirá mucho porque ya tienen sembrado el cultivo y el veneno le matará la mala hierba que va afectándole al cultivo para obtener excelente cosecha.

Manuel  es una persona que sueña con tener una parcela para trabajar y tiene claro que la única manera de hacer realidad su sueño es trabajando,  además seguirá estudiando porque su gran sueño es poder graduarse y sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Manuel is 23 years old, he is single and still lives with his parents and 5 siblings, and he is finishing his education with a lot of effort. 

Manuel has worked in agriculture since he was 12 years old; his dad would always bring him along to work. Currently, Manuel is studying the 8th grade. He goes to school in the afternoons, and in the mornings he goes to the country to cultivate the soil. This job is 10 minutes away and he travels to it by foot with his dad and one brother, there they work the morning from 6 to 12 

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is needed to purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer and a bottle of poison. These will be of great help because they already planted the crops and the poison will kill the weeds that affect the crops in order to have an excellent harvest. 

Manuel is a person who dreams of having his own plot to work on, and he is aware that the only way to make his dream come true is by working. Additionally, he will continue studying because his grand dream is to be able to graduate and have a college degree.

loans.use: to purchase six bags of fertilizer and a bottle of poison

loans.name: Santos Ovidio

texts.es: Don Santos, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos, y vive con su esposa, hija, yerno y nietos en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. En busca de obtener un ingreso para su familia ha establecido una pulpería donde vende refrescos, churros, verduras, granos básicos, azúcar, productos de limpieza, harina, huevos, pastas, etc. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace 1 años 10 meses luego de haber dejado de trabajar en una compañía azucarera. pero actualmente tiene un trabajo asalariado en otra empresa y el negocio lo atiende su esposa. El solicita 6,000 Lempiras para comprar manteca, pollo, refrescos, churros, pan, harina, productos de aseo etc. y tener surtido el negocio con el fin de mejorar las ventas. Sus planes son comprar un terreno para dejarle herencia a sus hijos, mejorar su casa y tener un buen negocio.
texts.en: Don Santos is 53 years old, married with 6 children, and lives with his wife, daughter, son-in-law and grandchildren in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. In order to earn an income for his family, he set up a convenience store where he sells soda, churros, vegetables, grains, sugar, cleaning products, flour, eggs, pasta, etc. He´s had this business for the past year and 10 months, after having stopped working in a sugar company. He currently has a paid job in another company and his wife tends to the store. He is asking for 6,000 Lempiras to buy butter, chicken, soda, churros, bread, flour, cleaning products, etc. and to supply the business with a way to improve sales. His plans are to buy a plot of land to leave to his children, to fix up his house, and to have a good business.

loans.use: to buy butter, chicken, soda, churros, bread, flour, cleaning products, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a small BBQ for chickens and service his stove

loans.name: Lidia Suyapa

texts.es: Lidia, tiene 26 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y reside con su familia en un sector que pertenece al Municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Lleva 9 años de dedicarse a su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de productos de elote (maíz tierno), como ser tamalitos, atole, elote hervido y montucas. Estos productos los vende de manera ambulante y en su casa. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras para comprar los materiales como ser el elote de maíz, carne, azúcar, sal, manteca, leña y otros para elaborar los tamalitos, atole y montucas para seguir vendiendo. Su plan es seguir creciendo y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en: Lidia is 26 years old, she is married, has two children, and lives with her family in an area that is part of the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. For 9 years, she has worked in her own business making and selling products made from sweet corn such as tamalitos, atole (a corn-based drink), boiled corn, and montucas (sweet corn tamal with meat). She sells these products as a street vendor and in her home. She has asked for a loan of 8,000 lempiras to purchase materials such as sweet corn, sugar, salt, butter, meat, firewood, etc., to make the tamalitos, atole and montucas to continue selling them. Her plan is to continue growing and that her children continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sweet corn, sugar, salt, butter, meat, firewood, etc., to make her products and sell them.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Airen aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

Having a water filter at home will help each member of the group to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, farmer's cheese, beans, chicharrón (pork rind), etc.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es: Ismael, tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, reside en una aldea del municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura, su fuente de ingresos es el cultivo de maíz, el cual lo vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando el cuarto ciclo de préstamo que es por 10,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y darle buen mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz. Tiene como meta seguir mejorando el cultivo para poderle ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Ismael is 58 years old, married, has 5 children, and lives in a town in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro. His entire life, he has worked in agriculture. His source of income is the cultivation of corn, which he sells in the local market. He is asking for this fourth loan cycle, which is for 10,000 lempiras, to purchase fertilizers and to care for his corn crop well.  He has as a goal to continue improving his crop to be able to help his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and care for his corn crop well.
